      7b
      Supramolecular Behavior of an Isomorphous Series of Five Bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) Complexes
      MacDonald, John C.; Luo, Tzy-Jiun M.; Palmore, G. Tayhas R.
      Crystal Growth & Design (2004), 4 (6), 1203-1209CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      The supramol. chem. and crystal structures of five bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) complexes, where M = Zn, Cu, Ni, Co, and 7:3 Mn/Cu (1-5, resp.), are reported. These complexes form building blocks with nearly identical mol. structures that crystallize in the same packing pattern. Anions of 2,6-dicarboxypyridine and cations of 2-methylimidazole form N-H···O and O-H···O H bonds that dominate crystal packing by forming linear ribbons of mols. Thus, complexes 1-5 form an isomorphous series with a single robust cryst. architecture that accommodates five different transition metals without altering mol. packing. The growth of crystals from solns. that contain two different metal complexes produces mixed crystals in which mixts. of the different metal complexes are incorporated in the same relative molar ratio present in soln. This technique was used to grow crystals of 5 with Mn and Cu complexes in a 7:3 molar ratio. Complexes 1-5 form cryst. solids that represent a novel class of modular materials in which the org. ligands serve as a structural component that defines a single packing arrangement that persists over a range of structures and in which the metal serves as an interchangeable component with which to vary the phys. properties of the material. The mol. and crystal structures of bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) complexes 1-5 are reported and compared to those of a related family of bis(imidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) dihydrate complexes 1'-5' (M = Zn, Cu, Ni, Co, and Mn) reported previously. Complexes 1-5 and 1'-5' have similar packing arrangements and introducing a Me substituent (similar in size to H2O) at the C2 position of imidazole displaces H2O and prevents it from being incorporated into the lattice of 1-5.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXmtFamsL4%253D&md5=2d7d06ae579d3c172aab22eb655e28ac
      (c) Mahata, P.; Natarajan, S. Inorg. Chem. 2007, 46, 1250
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      7c
      A New Series of Three-Dimensional Metal-Organic Framework, [M2(H2O)][C5N1H3(COO)2]3·2H2O, M = La, Pr, and Nd: Synthesis, Structure, and Properties
      Mahata, Partha; Natarajan, Srinivasan
      Inorganic Chemistry (2007), 46 (4), 1250-1258CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Lanthanide pyridinedicarboxylates, [M2(H2O)][C5N1H3(COO)2]3·2H2O, M = La (1), Pr (2), and Nd (3), were prepd. by the reaction of trivalent lanthanide salts and 2,3-pyridinedicarboxylic acid employing a mild condition hydrothermal reaction. The structures are built up from MO8N and MO7N2 (M = lanthanide) polyhedra connected to the dicarboxylate anions forming the three-dimensional structure with 1-dimensional channels. A striking feature of this structure is the presence of an unusual Z-shaped tetramer, M4O24N6. Extra-framework water mols., located within the open channels, are reversibly adsorbed. Detailed in situ and ex situ studies using FTIR and PXRD studies clearly show that the removal of the water mols. is reversible and accompanied by changes in the size of the channel. Partial substitution at the La sites by Eu gives rise to characteristic red-pink luminescence, indicating a ligand-sensitized metal-centered emission.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXktF2nuw%253D%253D&md5=87ded554f978365cd9b385a1291357e0

      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      7d
      Synthesis, X-ray Structures, and Fluorescent Properties of Coordination Networks Constructed from 2-(2-Pyridinyl-benzimidazolyl) Acetic Anion
      Wang, Zuo-Wei; Ji, Chang-Chun; Li, Jing; Guo, Zi-Jian; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zheng, He-Gen
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (1), 475-482CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Four new metal coordination polymers, [Cd(pybma)2]n (1), [Zn(pybma)(C2O4)0.5·0.5H2O]n (2), [Co(pybma)(C2O4)0.5]n (3), and [Zn3(pybma)2(HBTC)2(H2O)4]n (4) [pybma = (2-(2-pyridinyl)benzimidazol-1-yl)acetate; H3BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate], were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized by element analyses, IR spectroscopy, and single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses. Has a 1-dimensional (1D) chain structure, which contains two kinds of rings. Has a two-dimensional (2D) metal-org. framework and can be seen as the unity of two parallel double-stranded helixes, in which the helixes are bridged by oxalate ligands. Has a 2-dimensional framework built from 1-dimensional chains and ox bridges. Has 2-dimensional layer framework which is assembled into a three-dimensional (3D) framework with two kinds of channels. Polymers 1, 2, and 4 exhibit obvious fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp.; no fluorescent emission is obsd. in polymer 3.

      7e
      Zinc Pyromellitate Coordination Polymers with Bis(pyridylmethyl)piperazine Tethers: A Rare Binodal Network and a New Simple Self-Penetrated Topology
      Blake, Karyn M.; Lucas, Jacqueline S.; LaDuca, Robert L.
      Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (4), 1287-1293CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Hydrothermal reaction of zinc nitrate, pyromellitic acid (H4pyro), and isomeric bis(pyridylmethyl)piperazines has afforded a pair of three-dimensional (3D) coordination polymers with intriguing 3D topologies. {[Zn2(Hpyro)2(H2O)2(H2-3-bpmp)]·H2O}n [1, 3-bpmp = bis(3-pyridylmethyl)piperazine] exhibits octahedral coordination at zinc and possesses a rare 4,5-connected binodal net with (4462)(4466) tcs topol. {[Zn2(Hpyro)2(H2-4-bpmp)]·4H2O}n [2, 4-bpmp = bis(4-pyridylmethyl)piperazine] has tetrahedral coordination at zinc and an unprecedented yet very simple 3,4-connected binodal (4.82)(4.82103) self-penetrated topol. Pyridyl nitrogen donor disposition and coordination geometry preference play a large role in structure-direction in this system. Complexes 1 and 2 undergo blue-violet light emission on excitation with UV light.

      Masaoka, Shigeyuki; Tanaka, Daisuke; Nakanishi, Yasunori; Kitagawa, Susumu
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2004), 43 (19), 2530-2534CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Three supramol. isomers, [CuI2(μ4-BQ)(μ2-OAc)2]n (BQ = benzoquinone; α phase), [Cu12(μ3-BQ)(μ2-OAc)(μ3-OAc)]n (β phase), and [Cu12(μ2-BQ)(μ3-OAc)2]n (γ phase), were crystd. by redox reaction of hydroquinone with [Cu2(OAc)4(H2O)2] in ethanol. Bridging of Cu ions can occur via benzoquinone or acetate O atoms. All 3 isomers were characterized by x-ray crystallog.

      Temperature-dependent supramolecular stereoisomerism in porous copper coordination networks based on a designed carboxylate ligand
      Sun, Daofeng; Ke, Yanxiong; Mattox, Tracy M.; Ooro, Betty A.; Zhou, Hong-Cai

The polymeric complexes have PtS and NbO net topologies, resp. The polymeric complexes have similar thermal stabilities and their Langmuir surface areas and hydrogen storage capacities were detd.

      Zheng, Bo; Dong, Hao; Bai, Junfeng; Li, Yizhi; Li, Shuhua; Scheer, Manfred

Cd(OH)2 and squaric acid. The four complexes were characterized by x-ray crystallog.       8d
      Temperature-Controlled Synthesis of Metal-Organic Coordination Polymers: Crystal Structure, Supramolecular Isomerism, and Porous Property
      Kanoo, Prakash; Gurunatha, K. L.; Maji, Tapas Kumar
      Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (9), 4147-4156CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Five new supramol. metal-org. coordination polymers (MOCPs), {[Ni(bipy) (H2O)4](2,6-nds)·4H2O} (1), {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)·2H2O} (2), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (3), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (4), {[Cu (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (5) (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridyl; 2,6-nds = 2,6-naphthalenedisulfonate) have been synthesized and structurally characterized. Compds. 1 and 5 were synthesized at room temp. in H2O/EtOH medium, whereas 2-4 were isolated under hydrothermal conditions. Compds. 1-4 were synthesized maintaining the same stoichiometric ratio of metal and ligand under different reaction temps., and the different structures of the compds. indicate that the temp. plays a significant role in the construction of the coordination polymers. Structural characterization reveals that the one-dimensional [M(bipy)(H2O)4]2+ cationic chain is a basic building unit for all of the MOCPs, while 2,6-nds remains as a counteranion. In all cases, 2,6-nds counteranions interact with water and bipy mols. through strong hydrogen-bonding and π-π interactions to afford three-dimensional supramol. structures. Compds. 1-4 have the same building unit with different network superstructures and are related as supramol. isomers. Supramol. isomerism in 3 and 4 is very interesting since they have the same mol. formula, {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)}, and are polymorphs. Compds. 4 and 5 are isomorphous. The thermogravimetric study suggests that the dehydrated compds. are stable up to 300°. Furthermore, sorption studies suggest that dehydrated compds. of 1 and 2 are permanently porous.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXpvV2nsb4%253D&md5=e7efb7696e37adb4c0d793bff194b0f0

      9c
      Synthesis, structures and properties of Mn(II) coordination frameworks based on R-isophthalate (R = -CH3 or -C(CH3)3) and various dipyridyl-type co-ligands
      Ma, Lu-Fang; Wang, Li-Ya; Wang, Yao-Yu; Du, Miao; Wang, Jian-Ge
      CrystEngComm (2009), 11 (1), 109-117CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Five new Mn(II) metal-org. coordination polymers, [Mn(tbip)(bipy)]n (1), {[Mn(tbip)(dpe)]·1.5H2O}n (2), [Mn(tbip)(bpa)]n (3), [Mn(mip)(bpa)]n (4) and {[Mn3(mip)2(Hmip)2(bpp)2(H2O)2]·2H2O}n (5), were prepd. through hydrothermal reactions of Mn(II) acetate with H2tbip (H2tbip = 5-tert-Bu isophthalic acid) or H2mip (H2mip = 5-methylisophthalic acid) in the presence of different dipyridyl co-ligands (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridine, dpe = 1,2-bi(4-pyridyl)ethene, bpa = 1,2-bi(4-pyridyl)ethane and bpp = 1,3-di(4-pyridyl)propane). All these compds. were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectroscopy and x-ray single-crystal diffraction. The structures of 1 and 2 are constructed of [Mn2(tbip)2]n layers, which consist of alternate left- and right-handed helical chains, and further pillared by bipy or dpe ligands into a 3D porous framework. There are two different sizes of pores in 1 and 2. From the topol. point of view, both complexes 1 and 2 exhibit the rare rob network based on the dimeric [Mn(COO)]2 subunits as the 6-connected nodes. The ribbon-like chains having 8- and 16-membered rings in 3 and 4 result from dimeric Mn(II) units bridged by H2tbip or H2mip ligands, which are connected by the flexible dpa into 2D open layers. Complex 5 contains rare isophthalato-bridged trimanganese clusters as building units, which are further linked by mip anions to form a one-dimensional ladder-like chain with less common unidentate coordinated bpp decorated as pendants. The thermal stabilities and x-ray powder diffraction studies indicate that the microporous framework of 2 can keep stable even after the loss of guest water mols. In addn., dominant antiferromagnetic coupling was obsd. in compds. 1-3 and 5.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      9d
      Magnetic and luminescence properties of Cu(II), Cu(II)4O4 core, and Cd(II) mixed-ligand metal-organic frameworks constructed from 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane and benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate
      Habib, Hesham A.; Sanchiz, Joaquin; Janiak, Christoph
      Inorganica Chimica Acta (2009), 362 (7), 2452-2460CODEN: ICHAA3; ISSN:0020-1693. (Elsevier B.V.)
      The hydrothermal reaction of Cu(NO3)2·3H2O, Cu(ClO4)2·6H2O, or CdSO4·8/3H2O with benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) produced the mixed-ligand coordination polymers and networks (MOFs) 1∞{[Cu(H2btc)2(μ-btre)]} (1), 3∞{[Cu4(μ5-btc)2(μ3-OH)2(μ4-btre)]·2H2O} (2), and 3∞{[Cd3(μ6-btc)2(μ4-btre)]·H2O} (3). The centrosym. tetranuclear, chair-shaped or stepped-cubane Cu4O4 metal building unit in 2 has three different Cu contacts, each involving more than one bridging group. A quasi-butterfly magnetostructural model shows dominant antiferromagnetic interactions in this Cu4 unit with three different magnetic exchange pathways with 2J1 = 258, 2J2 = -416, and 2J3 = 484 cm-1 from the magnetic susceptibility measurement between 1.9 and 300 K. For this Cu4O4 unit the Eigenvalues assocd. with the zero field spin Hamiltonian were calcd. by solving the 16 × 16 matrix to obtain the numerical expression for the magnetic susceptibility. The Cd-btre framework 3, with bridged Cd strands, shows a strong bluish fluorescence at 421 nm upon excitation at 317 nm (not seen in the free btre ligand).

      Crystal structures and solid-state CPMAS 13C NMR correlations in luminescent zinc(II) and cadmium(II) mixed-ligand coordination polymers constructed from 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane and benzenedicarboxylate
      Habib, Hesham A.; Hoffmann, Anke; Hoeppe, Henning A.; Janiak, Christoph
      Dalton Transactions (2009), (10), 1742-1751CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The hydrothermal reaction of M(NO3)2·4H2O (M = Zn and Cd) with benzene-1,4-dicarboxylic acid (H2bdc) or benzene-1,3-dicarboxylic acid (H2i.p.) and 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) produced the mixed-ligand coordination polymers (MOFs) 3∞{[Zn2(μ2-bdc)2(μ4-btre)]} (1), 3∞{[Cd2(μ4-bdc)(μ4-btre)2](NO3)2·H2O} (2) and 2∞{[Zn2(μ3-i.p.)2(μ2-btre)(H2O)2]·2H2O} (3). The compds., characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, x-ray powder diffraction, solid-state cross-polarization (CP) magic-angle-spinning (MAS) 13C NMR and thermoanal., feature 3-dimensional metal-org. frameworks for 1 and 2 and 2-dimensional double layers which are connected through H bonds from the aqua ligands for 3. The CPMAS 13C NMR spectra picture the symmetry-independent (unique) C atoms and the bdc/i.p.-to-btre ligand ratio in agreement with the crystal structures. The Zn and Cd coordination polymers 1-3 show a strong bluish fluorescence upon excitation with UV light (the free btre ligand is nonluminescent).

      Mixed-ligand coordination polymers from 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane and benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate: Trinuclear nickel or zinc secondary building units for three-dimensional networks with crystal-to-crystal transformation upon dehydration
      Habib, Hesham A.; Sanchiz, Joaquin; Janiak, Christoph
      Dalton Transactions (2008), (13), 1734-1744CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The hydrothermal reaction of M(NO3)2·6H2O (M = Ni and Zn) with benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) produced the mixed-ligand coordination polymers (MOFs) 3∞{[Ni3(μ3-btc)2(μ4-btre)2(μ-H2O)2]·∼22H2O} (1) and 3∞{[Zn3(μ4-btc)2(μ4-btre)(H2O)2]·2H2O} (3). The compds., characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, x-ray powder diffraction and thermoanal. feature trinuclear secondary building units (SBU) within the three-dimensional frameworks. The trinuclear Ni unit in 1 exhibits an intra-trimer together with some weak inter-trimer antiferromagnetic coupling with J = -13.88(8) cm-1 from the magnetic susceptibility measurement between 1.9-300 K. The Zn coordination polymer 3 shows a strong fluorescence at 423 nm upon excitation at 323 nm (not seen in the free btre ligand). 3 Is thermally robust until 200° (ambient pressure) where loss of the H2O mols. starts. Careful control of the dehydration procedure (freeze-drying) for 1 and (heating to 280°) for 3 allowed for a solid-state reaction with single-crystal-to-single-crystal structural transformations in obtaining the largely dehydrated products 3∞{[Ni3(μ2-btc)2(μ4-btre)2(μ-H2O)2(H2O)2]·4H2O} (2) and 3∞{[Zn3(μ6-btc)2(μ4-btre)2]·∼0.67H2O} (4), resp. In the transformation from 1 to 2 the unit cell vol. is reduced to ∼60%. The transition from 3 to 4 involves breakage and formation of new Zn-O bonds.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXjsFCmt7k%253D&md5=2ac1c183ea1557f747851cabe999211a
      (g) Zhang, L. P.; Yang, J.; Ma, J. F.; Jia, Z. F.; Xie, Y. P.; Wei, G. H. CrystEngComm 2008, 10, 1410

      9g
      A series of 2D and 3D metal-organic frameworks based on different polycarboxylate anions and a flexible 2,2'-bis(1H-imidazolyl)ether ligand
      Zhang, Lai-Ping; Yang, Jin; Ma, Jian-Fang; Jia, Zhi-Fang; Xie, Yun-Peng; Wei, Guo-Hua
      CrystEngComm (2008), 10 (10), 1410-1420CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Eight new coordination polymers, namely [Ni(L1)(BIE)] (1), [Cu(L1)(BIE)] (2), [Cu(L2)(BIE)] (3), [Co(L3)(BIE)] (4), [Cu(L4)0.5(BIE)] (5), [Co2(L4)(BIE)2]·H2O (6), [Cu5(L5)4(μ3-O)2(BIE)2(H2O)2] (7) and [Cu3(L6)2(BIE)2(H2O)3] (8), where L1 = p-phthalate, L2 = o-phthalate, L3 = oxalate, L4 = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate, L5 = m-phthalate, L6 = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate and BIE = 2,2'-bis(1H-imidazolyl)ether, were successfully synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Polymers 1-4 display 2D layer structures. 1, 2 And 3 hold the similar 4-connected 44-sql nets, while 4 exhibits a 3-connected 63-hcb net. 5 Possesses an unusual 4-connected Kagome net with two kinds of connected nodes. 6 Shows a rare 3,4-connected (83)2(85·10) topol. with 3-connected nodes and square-planar 4-connected nodes. 7 Exhibits an α-Po topol. based on pentanuclear Cu(II) cluster. 8 Is a unique self-penetrating 2D network with 3,4-connected (6.72)(6.7.8)(62·7.82·9) topol. The structural differences of 1-8 suggest the importance of polycarboxylate ligands and central metals in the network construction of the coordination polymers.

      9h
      Chiral coordination polymers with amino acids: 2∞[Cu2(μ-L-tryptophanato)2(μ-4,4'-bipyridine)(H2O)2](NO2)2
      Wisser, Barbara; Lu, Yirong; Janiak, Christoph
      Zeitschrift fuer Anorganische und Allgemeine Chemie (2007), 633 (8), 1189-1192CODEN: ZAACAB; ISSN:0044-2313. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      The two-dimensional mixed-ligand network catena[(μ-4,4'-bipyridine)-bis(μ-L-tryptophanato-κ3N,O,O')-diaqua-di-copper(II)dinitrate] is constructed through the bridging action of both the tridentate amino carboxylato and the bidentate 4,4'-bipyridine ligand. The enantiomeric L-tryptophanato ligand acts as an N,O chelate towards one copper atom and bridges through the second carboxylate oxygen atom to the adjacent copper ion. Stacking of the corrugated nets creates channels which are occupied by the hydrogen-bonded and very weakly Cu-coordinating nitrate ions.

      Stabilization of the 2D inclined interpenetrated net of [Co(bpe)(tp)(H2O)2]n by replacement of lattice water molecules with appropriate solvent
      Manna, Subal Chandra; Okamoto, Ken-ichi; Zangrando, Ennio; Chaudhuri, Nirmalendu Ray
      CrystEngComm (2007), 9 (3), 199-202CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A 1-pot reaction of three different components [Co(II), terephthalate dianion (tp) and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe)] in water-MeOH (1:1) solvent leads to the self assembly of a 2-dimensional inclined interpenetrated network {[Co(bpe)(tp)(H2O)2]·2.5(H2O)}n (1), stabilized as {[Co(bpe)(tp)(H2O)2]·(glycol)}n (2) when the reaction is carried out in (1:1) H2O-glycol medium.

      9l
      Crystal engineering of 3-D coordination polymers by pillaring ferromagnetic copper(II)-methylmalonate layers
      Pasan, Jorge; Sanchiz, Joaquin; Lloret, Francesc; Julve, Miguel; Ruiz-Perez, Catalina
      CrystEngComm (2007), 9 (6), 478-487CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Three new Cu(II) complexes [Cu(Memal)(H2O)]n (1), [Cu2(pyz)(Memal)2] (2) and [Cu2(4,4'-bpy)(Memal)2(H2O)2] (3) (Memal = methylmalonate, pyz = pyrazine and 4,4'-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine) were obtained and structurally characterized by x-ray diffraction. Complex 1 is a square grid of aquacopper(II) units which are linked by carboxylate-methylmalonate groups in the anti-syn (equatorial-equatorial) coordination mode. The crystal structures of 2 and 3 consist of corrugated layers of Cu(II) (2) and aquacopper(II) (3) units with intralayer carboxylate-methylmalonate bridges in the anti-syn (equatorial-apical) coordination mode which are linked through pyrazine (2) and 4,4'-bipyridine (3) ligands, to build up a 3-dimensional network. Magnetic susceptibility measurements of complexes 1-3 in the temp. range 2-300 K show the occurrence of an overall ferromagnetic behavior with a weak intralayer ferromagnetic coupling (J = +1.61(1) cm-1) in 1 whereas two opposite magnetic interactions occur in 2 and 3, one ferromagnetic through the anti-syn carboxylate (2 and 3) and the other antiferromagnetic through pyz (2) and 4,4'-bpy (3).
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      (m) Stephenson, M. D.; Hardie, M. J. Dalton Trans. 2006, 3407
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar

      Coordination and hydrogen bonded network structures of Cu(II) with mixed ligands: a hybrid hydrogen bonded material, an infinite sandwich arrangement, and a 3-D net
      Stephenson, Maria D.; Hardie, Michaele J.
      Dalton Transactions (2006), (28), 3407-3417CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Mixed-ligand Cu(II) complexes with deprotonated trimesic acid and phenanthroline-type ligands were synthesized by solvothermal methods to form 2-dimensional infinite hexagonal H bonded structures with addnl. trimesic acid (H3tma) mols. [Cu(phendione)2(H2tma)2]·2(H3tma)·1.65(CF3CH2OH)·2.5(H2O), where phendione = 1,10-phenanthroline-5,6-dione, has H bonded networks of [Cu(phendione)2(H2tma)2] complexes interspersed with layers of H3tma with a topol. identical H bonding network. Whereas in [Cu(1,10-phenanthroline)(H2tma)2]2·2(H3tma), a dimeric Cu(II) complex H bonds directly to addnl. H3tma mols. to form a three-layered 2-dimensional network resembling an infinite sandwich. The synthesis and structures of simple Cu(II) complexes of the phendione ligand are also reported. One of these, [Cu(phendione)2Br2] shows a particularly polar packing arrangement.

      9n
      Hydrothermal synthesis, crystal structures and effect of nonbonding interactions in crystal packing of two mixed-ligand metal complexes with glycolato and 2,2'-dipiridylamine and with benzilato and imidazole
      Carballo, Rosa; Covelo, Berta; Vazquez-Lopez, Ezequiel M.; Garcia-Martinez, Emilia; Castineiras, Alfonso; Janiak, Christoph
      Zeitschrift fuer Anorganische und Allgemeine Chemie (2005), 631 (11), 2006-2010CODEN: ZAACAB; ISSN:0044-2313. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Two new mixed-ligand complexes [Fe(HG)2(dipyam)] (1) (HG = glycolato and dipyam = 2,2'-dipyridylamine) and [Cu(HB)2(Im)2]·2H2O (2) (HB = benzilato and Im = imidazole) were hydrothermally synthesized and structurally characterized by x-ray diffraction. In both cases the metallic center is in an octahedral environment, strongly distorted in 2 (4+2 coordination). The α-hydroxycarboxylato ligands (glycolato or benzilato) present different coordinative behavior, bidentate chelate through the hydroxyl O and one carboxy O in 1 and through the two O atoms of the carboxylate group in 2. The complexes are extended into 2-dimensional frameworks through H bonding and π···π or C-H···π interactions. The complexes were also characterized by elemental anal., FTIR and UV-visible spectroscopy and room temp. magnetic measurements.

      Three-dimensional metal-organic frameworks constructed from bix and 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylate
      Yao, Jing; Lu, Zhen-Da; Li, Yi-Zhi; Lin, Jian-Guo; Duan, Xian-Ying; Gao, Song; Meng, Qing-Jin; Lu, Chang-Sheng
      CrystEngComm (2008), 10 (10), 1379-1383CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Two new metal-org. complexes [Cd1.5(btrc)(bix)]n (1) and [Zn2(btrc)(Hbtrc)0.5(bix)2]n (2) (btrc = 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylate; bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene) were hydrothermally synthesized and characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction. Complex 1 represents a three-dimensional (3D) structure based on the 2D sheets and bix pillars. Complex 2 exhibits unique architecture. The two complexes exhibit strong fluorescent emissions in their solid states at room temp.

      Syntheses, structures and luminescent properties of zinc(II) and cadmium(II) coordination complexes based on new bis(imidazolyl)ether and different carboxylate ligands
      Wei, Guo-Hua; Yang, Jin; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Ying-Ying; Li, Shun-Li; Zhang, Lai-Ping
      Dalton Transactions (2008), (23), 3080-3092CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Mixed-ligand coordination complexes, [Zn(CA)2(BIE)] (1), [Zn(OX)(BIE)]·H2O (2), [Zn2(m-BDC)2(BIE)2] (3), [Cd(m-BDC)(BIE)] (4), [Cd(5-OH-m-BDC)(BIE)] (5), [Zn(5-OH-m-BDC)(BIE)] (6), [Zn2(p-BDC)2(BIE)2]·2.5H2O (7), [Cd3(p-BDC)3(BIE)] (8), [Cd3(BTC)2(BIE)2]·0.5H2O (9) and [Zn(BTCA)0.5(BIE)] (10), where CA = cinnamate anion, OX = oxalate anion, m-BDC = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate anion, 5-OH-m-BDC = 5-OH-1,3-benzenedicarboxylate anion, p-BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate anion, BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate anion, BTCA = 1,2,3,4-butanetetracarboxylate anion, and BIE = 2,2'-bis(1H-imidazolyl)ether, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by x-ray crystallog. In 1, a pair of BIE ligands bridge adjacent Zn(II) atoms to give a centrosym. dimer. In 2 and 3, BIE ligands connect Zn(II)-carboxylate chains to form hexagonal honeycomb 63-hcb and square 44-sql layers, resp. In 4 and 5, m-BDC and 5-OH-m-BDC bridge Cd(II) atoms to give dimeric units, resp., which are further linked by BIE ligands to form sql nets. In 6, the BIE ligands extend the Zn(II)-carboxylate chains into 2-dimensional sinusoidal-like sql nets. The undulated sql nets polycatenate each other in the parallel manner with DOC (degree of catenation) = 2, yielding a rare 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional parallel polycatenation net. In 7, the BIE and p-BDC ligands link the Zn(II) atoms to give a rare 3-fold interpenetrated 3-connected 103-ths net. 8 Contains unusual edge-sharing polyhedral rods formed by [Cd3(CO2)6] clusters. Each rod is connected by the benzene rings of p-BDC in four directions into a simple α-Po topol. In 9, two kinds of different 2-dimensional Cd-BTC layers are alternately linked to each other by sharing Cd(II) centers to form a 3-dimensional framework, which is further linked by two kinds of BIE ligand to produce a complicated 3-dimensional polymeric structure. 10 Possesses a unique (3,4)-connected 3-dimensional framework with (83)2(85·10) topol. The structural differences described indicate the importance of carboxylate ligands and metals in the framework formation of coordination complexes. The IR spectra, thermogravimetric and luminescent properties were also studied in detail for the compds.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      9q
      A manganese(II) coordination polymer with mixed pyrimidine-2-carboxylate and oxalate bridges: synthesis, structure, and magnetism
      Zhang, Jian-Yong; Ma, Yu; Cheng, Ai-Ling; Yue, Qi; Sun, Qian; Gao, En-Qing
      Dalton Transactions (2008), (15), 2061-2066CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A new two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymer with mixed pyrimidine-2-carboxylate (pymca) and oxalate (ox) bridges, [Mn2(pymca)2(ox)(H2O)2]n (1), was synthesized by a hydrothermal reaction involving the in-situ formation of the pymca and ox ligands from 2-cyanopyrimidine (pymCN), and its structure and magnetic properties were characterized. The dianionic ox and monoanionic pymca ligands are both potentially bis(chelating) and have been used to construct anionic and cationic 2D honeycomb networks [(6,3) net], resp. In 1 ox assumes the usual bis(chelating) bridging mode but pymca serves as a tridentate bridge with one of the pyrimidyl nitrogens uncoordinated. The two different bridges collaborate to generate a highly undulated 2D layer with the (6,3) net topol. and the layers are closely packed in parallel through π-π interactions between pyrimidyl rings and hydrogen bonds involving coordinated water mols., oxalate oxygens, and uncoordinated pyrimidyl nitrogens. Magnetic measurements reveal that the compd. is a spin-canted antiferromagnet with weak ferromagnetic transition below Tc = 2.4 K.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXkt1Sqtbo%253D&md5=89c84c49f52fc1830db1937b10f0204f

      (a) Habib, H. A.; Hoffmann, A.; Hoppe, H. A.; Steinfeld, G.; Janiak, C. Inorg. Chem. 2009, 48, 2166
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10a
      Crystal Structure Solid-State Cross Polarization Magic Angle Spinning 13C NMR Correlation in Luminescent d10 Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed with the 1,2-Bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane Ligand
      Habib, Hesham A.; Hoffmann, Anke; Hoppe, Henning A.; Steinfeld, Gunther; Janiak, Christoph
      Inorganic Chemistry (2009), 48 (5), 2166-2180CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Hydrothermal reactions of 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) with copper(II), zinc(II), and cadmium(II) salts have yielded the dinuclear complexes [Zn2Cl4(μ2-btre)2] (1) and [Zn2Br4(μ2-btre)2] (2), the one-dimensional coordination polymer ∞1[Zn(NCS)2(μ2-btre)] (3), the two-dimensional networks ∞2[Cu2(μ2-Cl)2(μ4-btre)] (4), ∞2[Cu2(μ2-Br)2(μ4-btre)] (5), and ∞2{[Cd6(μ3-OH)2(μ3-SO4)4(μ4-btre)3(H2O)6](SO4)·∼6H2O} (6), and the three-dimensional frameworks ∞3{[Cu(μ4-btre)]ClO4·∼0.25H2O} (7), ∞3{[Zn(μ4-btre)(μ2-btre)](ClO4)2} (8), ∞3{[Cd(μ4-btre)(μ2-btre)](ClO4)2} (9), and ∞3[Cu2(μ2-CN)2(μ4-btre)] (10, 2-fold 3D interpenetrated framework). The copper-contg. products 4, 5, 7, and 10 contain the metal in the +1 oxidn. state, from a simultaneous redox and self-assembly reaction of the Cu(II) starting materials. The cyanide-contg. framework 10 has captured the CN- ions from the oxidative btre decompn. The perchlorate frameworks 7, 8, or 9 react in an aq. NH4+PF6- soln. with formation of the related PF6--contg. frameworks. The differences in the metal-btre bridging mode (μ2-κN1:N1', μ2-κN1:N2 or μ4-κN1:N2:N1':N2') and the btre ligand symmetry can be correlated with different signal patterns in the 13C cross polarization magic angle spinning (CPMAS) NMR spectra. Compds. 2, 4, 5 and 7 to 10 exhibit fluorescence at 403-481 nm upon excitation at 270-373 nm which is not seen in the free btre ligand.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXhtFOks74%253D&md5=6748aa949a09f598e02b5ae3facc3db0
      (b) Lan, Y. Q.; Li, S. L.; Fu, Y. M.; Xu, Y. H.; Li, L.; Su, Z. M.; Fu, Q. Dalton Trans. 2008, 6796
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10b
      d10-Metal coordination polymers based on analogue di(pyridyl)imidazole derivatives and 4,4'-oxydibenzoic acid: influence of flexible and angular characters of neutral ligands on structural diversity
      Lan, Ya-Qian; Li, Shun-Li; Fu, Yao-Mei; Xu, Yan-Hong; Li, Lu; Su, Zhong-Min; Fu, Qiang
      Dalton Transactions (2008), (47), 6796-6807CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Mixed-ligand coordination complexes, [Zn(L1)(oba)] (1), [Cd(L1)(oba)] (2), [Zn2(L2)(oba)2]·8H2O (3), [Cd2(L2)(oba)2]·2H2O (4), [Zn3(L3)(oba)3] (5), [Cd2(L3)(oba)2]·(L3) (6), [Cd(L4)(oba)]·H2O (7) and [Cd(L5)(oba)]·3H2O (8), where L1 = 2-(2-pyridyl)imidazole, L2 = 1,4-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-yl]butane, L3 = 1,4-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene, L4 = 1,3-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene, L5 = 1,2-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene and H2oba = 4,4'-oxydibenzoic acid, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Their structures were detd. by single crystal x-ray diffraction analyses and further characterized by elemental analyses, IR spectra, and thermogravimetric (TG) analyses. In 1 and 2, oba2-, L1 ligand and ZnII or CdII ions form parallel chains or parallel sheets which are linked by the weak H bonding and π···π stacking interactions to give the 2-dimensional supramol. sheet or 3-dimensional supramol. net, resp. For 3, L2 ligands connect [Zn(oba)] chains to generate a (10,3)-b topol. structure, the 1st example of 8-fold interpenetrating framework based on the (10,3)-b net. In 4, L2 ligands link [Cd(oba)] double-chains to give a 2-dimensional sheet which is assembled by π···π stacking interactions to obtain a 3-dimensional supramol. net. In 5, L3 ligands link ZnII ions from α-Po net formed by ZnII ions and oba2- anions to show a novel 3-dimensional 8-connected self-penetrating framework with the unreported (416·611·8) topol. structure. In 6, the double-chains constructed by CdII and oba2- anions are linked by one kind of L3 ligand to form a layer-like structure which is assembled by π···π stacking interactions to show a 3-dimensional supramol. structure. In 7, oba2- anions coordinate to CdII cations to form chains which are connected by L4 to form a 4-fold interpenetrating diamond network. In 8, the weak H bonding and π···π stacking interactions connect the [Cd(L5)(oba)] chains to give a 2-dimensional supramol. sheet. From the structures of 1-8, the different flexible and angular neutral ligands, coordination geometries of metal centers and weak interactions (H bonds and π···π stacking interactions) are crucial factors for the formation of the different structures. The photoluminescent properties of 1-8 were studied in the solid state at room temp.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhsVajtbjI&md5=128df781c8bfc965ddaedd32b0f3e17f
      (c) Ren, P.; Liu, M. L.; Zhang, J.; Shi, W.; Cheng, P.; Liao, D. Z.; Yan, S. P. Dalton Trans. 2008, 4711
      [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
      10c
      1D, 2D and 3D luminescent zinc(II) coordination polymers assembled from varying flexible thioether ligands
      Ren, Peng; Liu, Ming-Li; Zhang, Jun; Shi, Wei; Cheng, Peng; Liao, Dai-Zheng; Yan, Shi-Ping
      Dalton Transactions (2008), (35), 4711-4713CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      Using a series flexible thioether ligands, 4-(2-pyridylmethylthio)benzoic acid (HL1), 4-(4-pyridylmethylthio)benzoic acid (HL2) and 4-(3-pyridylmethylthio)benzoic acid (HL3), a 1-dimensional infinite chain [Zn3(L1)6]n (1), a 2-dimensional interpenetrating sheet [Zn(L2)2]n (2), and a chiral 3-dimensional framework [Zn(L3)2H2O]n (3) were obtained. Luminescent properties of these compds. were also studied.

      (a) Ryan, P. E.; Lescop, C.; Laliberté, D.; Hamilton, T.; Maris, T.; Wuest, J. D. Inorg. Chem. 2009, 48, 2793
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      11a
      Engineering New Metal-Organic Frameworks Built from Flexible Tetrapyridines Coordinated to Cu(II) and Cu(I)
      Ryan, Patrick E.; Lescop, Christophe; Laliberte, Dominic; Hamilton, Tamara; Maris, Thierry; Wuest, James D.
      Inorganic Chemistry (2009), 48 (7), 2793-2807CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      New metal-org. frameworks were constructed by the coordination of Cu(II) and Cu(I) with pentaerythrityl tetrakis(4-pyridyl) ether (1 = PETPE), a flexible tetradentate ligand. Networks derived from Cu(OOCCH3)2, Cu(NO3)2, and CuBF4 proved to have different topologies (diamondoid, PtS, and SrAl2, resp.). This reflects (1) the ability of PETPE (1) to adopt diverse conformations and (2) the varied geometries of complexes of Cu(II) and Cu(I). Extended PETPE (I; R = H (2)), a tetrapyridine with Ph spacers inserted into the pentaerythrityl core of PETPE (1), yielded an expanded version of the PtS network derived from simple PETPE (1) and Cu(NO3)2. However, increases in the ability of the network to accommodate guests were largely offset by interpenetration of independent networks. Attempts to thwart interpenetration by converting ligand 2 into Me-substituted deriv. (I; R = Me (3)) led to the construction of networks with alternative topologies. In particular, the reactions of ligand 3 with both Cu(II) and Cu(I) yielded isostructural Pt3O4 networks, despite the preference of the two oxidn. states for coordination spheres with different geometries. Together, these observations demonstrate that PETPE (1) and related compds. are useful ligands for constructing metal-org. frameworks, with a distinctive ability to accommodate a single metal in different oxidn. states, as well as to adapt to a metal in a single oxidn. state but with different counterions or secondary ligands.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXivVeit7o%253D&md5=78be00af9a9fbef7ca1b27dd0a0a193b
      (b) Zhang, Q. C.; Bu, X. H.; Lin, Z. E.; Wu, T.; Feng, P. Y. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 9724
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar

      Organization of Tetrahedral Chalcogenide Clusters Using a Tetrahedral Quadridentate Linker
      Zhang, Qichun; Bu, Xianhui; Lin, Zhien; Wu, Tao; Feng, Pingyun
      Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2008), 47 (21), 9724-9726CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Using predesigned tetrahedral quadridentate linker tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane (TPOM) as the org. linker, tetrahedral P1 clusters ([Cd8S(SPh)16]2-) and C1 clusters ([Cd17S4(SPh)28]2-) were assembled into beltlike {[Cd8S(SPh)14](TPOM)}n (MCOF-9) or chainlike {[Cd17S4(SPh)26](TPOM)}n (MCOF-10) configurations, as detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction. The onset of optical absorptions of MCOF-9 and MCOF-10 is ∼400 and 420 nm, resp. The thermal anal. shows that both materials are stable up to 250°.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      11c
      Syntheses, Structures, and Photoluminescence of Five New Metal-Organic Frameworks Based on Flexible Tetrapyridines and Aromatic Polycarboxylate Acids
      Hu, Jin-Song; Shang, Yong-Jia; Yao, Xiao-qiang; Qin, Ling; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen; Xue, Zi-Ling
      Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (6), 2676-2684CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Solvothermal reactions of tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane (TPOM) with deprotonated 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate (H2bdc) or 5-hydroxyisophthalic acid (5-OH-H2bdc) in the presence of nitrates of cadmium, zinc, and cobalt in H2O or H2O/DMF produced five new complexes, namely, {[Cd2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)5(DMF)}n (1), {[Zn2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)4}n (2), {[Zn2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)}n (3), {[Co2(TPOM)(5-OH-bdc)2(H2O)2]·(H2O)5}n (4), and {[Cd2(TPOM)(5-OH-bdc)2]·(H2O)2}n (5). These complexes were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and x-ray single-crystal diffraction. Complex 1 reveals a 2-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional (3D) framework with pcu topol. constructed from binuclear Cd clusters and TPOM ligands. In addn., the expt. of single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SC-SC) structural transformations upon guest exchange was tested. Zn complexes 2 and 3 possess different 3D frameworks and are prepd. from TPOM and H2bdc under different reaction conditions. In complexes 4 and 5, TPOM and 5-OH-H2bdc link Co or Cd centers to generate 3D interpenetrating frameworks with bbf and qtz topol. In addn., thermal stabilities and photochem. properties of these new complexes in the solid state have been studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      A new, triply-interpenetrating diamondoid metal-org. framework, which exhibits strong photoluminescence at room temp. and high thermal stability, was prepd. by the self-assembly of tetrahedral quadridentate linker tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane and tetrahedral Cu4I4 clusters under solvothermal conditions.

      Highly interpenetrated supramolecular networks supported by N···I halogen bonding
      Metrangolo, Pierangelo; Meyer, Franck; Pilati, Tullio; Proserpio, Davide M.; Resnati, Giuseppe
      Chemistry--A European Journal (2007), 13 (20), 5765-5772CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Halogen bonding (XB) has been used to assemble tetrakis(4-pyridyl)pentaerythritol (tetradentate XB acceptor) with different α,ω-diiodoperfluoroalkanes (bidentate XB donors) or tetrakis(4-iodotetrafluorophenyl)-pentaerythritol (tetradentate XB donor). The remarkable linearity of the XB formed, the rodlike character of α,ω-diiodoperfluoroalkanes and the mutual complementarities of pentaerythritol partners, translate the three-dimensional character of the XB accept- or into open primary networks, which interpenetrate to avoid the presence of voids and to ensure segregation of the modules. Two-dimensional (2D) square 44 layers (sql) with fourfold and fivefold interpenetration, as well as an eightfold diamondoid network (dia) of class la and a remarkable tenfold dia network of class IIIa, have been obtained.

      15a
      Syntheses, Structures, and Physical Properties of Three Novel Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed from Aromatic Polycarboxylate Acids and Flexible Imidazole-Based Synthons
      Wen, Lili; Lu, Zhenda; Lin, Jianguo; Tian, Zhengfang; Zhu, Huizhen; Meng, Qingjin
      Crystal Growth & Design (2007), 7 (1), 93-99CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Three novel interesting coordination polymers, [Cd3(SIP)2(bbi)5·3H2O]n (1), [Co3(SIP)2(bix)4(2H2O)·2H2O]n (2), and [Cd(2,5-pydc)2(bix)1.5·H2O]n (3) (SIP = 5-sulfoisophthalic acid monosodium salt; bbi = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole); bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)-benzene; 2,5-pydc = pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid), were isolated under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized. Polymer 1 has a 3-dimensional complicated framework comprised of an infinite 1-dimensional ladder-like chain and 2-dimensional layer structure. Polymer 2 features a 3-dimensional hydrated framework with uncoordinated H2O mols. trapped in the pores. Polymer 3 is a 2-dimensional infinite layer framework, which is further interconnected by H-bond interactions to lead to a 3-dimensional supramol. architecture. Compds. 1 and 3 exhibit medium-strong fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp. and could be significant in the field of photoactive materials.

      15b
      Series of 2D and 3D Coordination Polymers Based on 1,2,3,4-Benzenetetracarboxylate and N-Donor Ligands: Synthesis, Topological Structures, and Photoluminescent Properties
      Zhang, Lai-Ping; Ma, Jian-Fang; Yang, Jin; Pang, Yuan-Yuan; Ma, Ji-Cheng
      Inorganic Chemistry (2010), 49 (4), 1535-1550CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      Nine new coordination polymers, namely, [Mn2(L)(H2O)4]·H2O (1), [Cd(L)0.5(H2O)] (2), [Zn5(L)2(μ3-O)2(H2O)4]·2H2O (3), [Zn4(L)2(μ3-O)2][Zn(H2O)6]·2H2O (4), [Zn2(L)(biim-4)0.5(H2O)3]·H2O (5), [Cd2(L)(bpy)(H2O)]·2H2O·0.5(CH3CH2OH) (6), [Cu2(H2L)2(bpy)2] (7), [Cu2(L)(bpy)(H2O)] (8), and [Cu2(L)(bpy)1.5(H2O)2.5] (9), where H4L = 1,2,3,4-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, biim-4 = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole), and bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Compd. 1 displays a rare trinodal (3,4,7)-connected (42·6)(45·6)(47·68·86) topol. 2 Possesses an α-Po net. 3 Is a novel 3-dimensional framework based on pentanuclear ZnII clusters. By adjustment of the pH values of the reaction mixt. of 3 with a Na2CO3 soln., a structurally different compd., 4, was obtained, which exhibits a 3-dimensional porous framework with the [Zn(H2O)6]2+ cations located in the channels. 5 Is an unusual example of a trinodal (3,5)-connected network with a Schlafli symbol of (42·6)(62·8)(42·62·85·10), whereas 6, contg. tetranuclear CdII clusters, shows a rare (4,6)-connected (44·62)2(44·610·8) topol. 7 Exhibits a unique polythreading network, while 8 displays a scarce trinodal (3,4,5)-connected self-penetrating network. In comparison with 8, the chiral compd. 9 possesses an unprecedented tetranodal (2,4)-connected (7)(75·11)(62·73·8)2(6·74 × 10)2 topol. The effects of the carboxylate ligands, the pH values, the reaction temps., the central metals, and the neutral ligands were elucidated. The IR spectra, TGA, and luminescent properties for the compds. were also studied.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      16
      Magnetic properties of six-coordinated high-spin cobalt(II) complexes: Theoretical background and its application
      Lloret, Francesc; Julve, Miguel; Cano, Joan; Ruiz-Garcia, Rafael; Pardo, Emilio
      Inorganica Chimica Acta (2008), 361 (12-13), 3432-3445CODEN: ICHAA3; ISSN:0020-1693. (Elsevier B.V.)
      In this contribution the authors study and analyze the influence of the different parameters involved in the magnetic susceptibility of six-coordinated high-spin Co(II) complexes. The authors propose an empirical expression to fit the magnetic susceptibility of polycryst. samples of mononuclear Co(II) complexes with an axial distortion, the variable parameters being Δ (axial distortion), α (orbital redn. factor) and λ (spin-orbit coupling). This expression avoids solving the 12 × 12 matrix assocd. to the distortion of the 4T1g term. To take into account the magnetic coupling (J) in the polynuclear Co(II) complexes, a perturbational approach is proposed to describe their magnetic susceptibility in the whole temp. range (2-300 K) as a function of J, Δ, α and λ. This approach is valid in the limit of the weak magnetic coupling as compared to the spin-orbit coupling, |J/λ| < 0.1. The model allows the treatment of each cobalt(II) ion in axial symmetry as an effective spin S eff = 1/2. That causes a drastic redn. of the matrix size of the polynuclear compds. from 12n × 12n to 2n × 2n, n being the no. of Co(II) ions in the complex. The main advantage of the model is to make possible the fit of the magnetic susceptibility data of those polynuclear Co(II) complexes whose high nuclearity involved intractable matrixes.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXpvVylsrg%253D&md5=28fd9a06b3d9d8d8ff80ddebf6f9ee1e

      17a
      Ferroelectric Copper Quinine Complexes
      Zhao, Hong; Qu, Zhi-Rong; Ye, Qiong; Abrahams, Brendan F.; Wang, Yi-Ping; Liu, Zhi-Guo; Xue, Ziling; Xiong, Ren-Gen; You, Xiao-Zeng
      Chemistry of Materials (2003), 15 (22), 4166-4168CODEN: CMATEX; ISSN:0897-4756. (American Chemical Society)
      The synthesis, solid-state structures, thermal stabilities, and ferroelec. properties of Cu5Cl9(H2Quinine)2 (I), and Cu3Br7(H2Quinine)2(H2O) (II) are reported. I was obtained by the reaction of CuCl, quinine, and HCl in methanol under solvothermal conditions at 60 -70°C. II was obtained under similar conditions using CuBr and HBr. These reactions are represented described. Thermogravimetric anal. (TGA) of these polycryst. complexes indicated no wt. loss below ca. 200 and 240 °C for I and II, resp. EPR spectra of the complexes are all silent, confirming that the oxidn. state of Cu ions in these solid complexes is +1. The crystal structure of I showed an anionic one-dimensional polymer of compn. of [Cu5Cl94-]n.

      A Mixed-Valence Coordination Polymer Featuring Two-Dimensional Ferroelectric Order: {[CuI4CuII(Et2dtc)2Cl3][CuII(Et2dtc)2]2(FeCl4)}n (Et2dtc- = diethyldithiocarbamate)
      Okubo, Takashi; Kawajiri, Ryo; Mitani, Tadaoki; Shimoda, Tatsuya
      Journal of the American Chemical Society (2005), 127 (50), 17598-17599CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
      The 1st mixed-valence coordination polymer indicating ferroelec. properties, {[CuI4CuII(Et2dtc)2Cl3][CuII(Et2dtc)2]2(FeCl4)}n (Et2dtc- = diethyldithiocarbamate), was synthesized and crystallog. characterized. This complex has a two-dimensional infinite square lattice structure, including both Cu(I) and Cu(II) ions, which is confirmed by XPS and SQUID measurements. The ferroelec. behaviors are revealed by the dielec. measurements with a LCR meter and a ferroelec. tester.

      17c
      Coexistence of ferroelectricity and ferromagnetism in a rubidium manganese hexacyanoferrate
      Ohkoshi, Shin-ichi; Tokoro, Hiroko; Matsuda, Tomoyuki; Takahashi, Hitomi; Irie, Hiroshi; Hashimoto, Kazuhito
      Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2007), 46 (18), 3238-3241CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
      Multiferroic material RbI0.82MnII0.20MnIII0.80[FeII(CN)6]0.80[FeIII(CN)6]0.14·H2O displays both ferroelectricity, explained by a mixing of FeII, FeIII, Fe vacancies, MnII, and Jahn-Teller-distorted MnIII centers, and ferromagnetism, caused by a parallel ordering of the magnetic spins of MnIII.
      >> More from SciFinder ®

      Zhou, Wei-Wei; Chen, Jiu-Tong; Xu, Gang; Wang, Ming-Sheng; Zou, Jian-Ping; Long, Xi-Fa; Wang, Guo-Jian; Guo, Guo-Cong; Huang, Jin-Shun
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2008), (24), 2762-2764CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      A novel 3-D (3,6)-connected topol. architecture, [Cd(trtr)2]n, obtained by reacting Cd(ClO4)2·6H2O with Htrtr (Htrtr = 3-(1,2,4-triazole-4-yl)-1H-1,2,4-triazole) under solvothermal conditions, presents a non-centrosym. polar packing arrangement as indicated by X-ray crystallog., resulting in a strong second harmonic generation (SHG) response and ferroelec. property.

      17e
      Observation of Ferroelectricity in Paramagnetic Copper Octacyanomolybdate
      Nakagawa, Kosuke; Tokoro, Hiroko; Ohkoshi, Shin-ichi
      Inorganic Chemistry (2008), 47 (23), 10810-10812CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
      The authors report the observation of ferroelectricity in a copper octacyanomolybdate-based paramagnet, Cu2[Mo(CN)8]·8H2O (CuII, S = 1/2; MoIV, S = 0). This compd. has a f.p. for the fixation of hydrogen bonding at 150 K. Around this temp., an enhancement in the ferroelectricity and an increase in the dielec. const. are obsd. The ferroelectricity of this system is classified into amorphous ferroelecs.; i.e., the elec. poling effect induces an elec. polarization. The elec. polarization is maintained by the structural local disorder of hydrogen bonding and the three-dimensional CN network. In this ferroelectricity, the crystal structure is a polar group of C∞v after application of an elec. field.

      17f
      Assembling chirality into magnetic nanowires: cyano-bridged iron(III)-nickel(II) chains exhibiting slow magnetization relaxation and ferroelectricity
      Wang, Cai-Feng; Li, Dong-Ping; Chen, Xin; Li, Xiao-Ming; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zuo, Jing-Lin; You, Xiao-Zeng
      Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2009), (45), 6940-6942CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
      The assembly of chirality into magnetic nanowires enables the formation of two new cyano-bridged heterobimetallic 3,2-chain enantiomeric complexes {[(Tp)2Fe2(CN)6Ni3(L)6](ClO4)4·2H2O}n (L = (1S,2S)- and (1R,2R)-cyclohexane-1,2-diamine), representing the first example of multiferroic compds. bearing both slow magnetization relaxation and ferroelectricity. The crystal structures of both enantiomers were detd. The structure consists of {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3Ni(L)2]2}2+ and [Ni(L)2]2+ units bridged by CN groups.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXhtl2iu73J&md5=8b98af996dc095b48064a8de2c4980d4
      (g) Zhao, H. R.; Li, D. P.; Ren, X. M.; Song, Y.; Jin, W. Q. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2010, 132
      Google Scholar
      There is no corresponding record for this reference.
      (h) Liang, X. Q.; Li, D. P.; Li, C. H.; Zhou, X. H.; Li, Y. Z.; Zuo, J. L.; You, X. Z. Cryst. Growth Des. 2010, 10, 2596
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      17h
      Syntheses, Structures, and Physical Properties of Camphorate Coordination Polymers Controlled by Semirigid Auxiliary Ligands with Variable Coordination Positions and Conformations
      Liang, Xiao-Qiang; Li, Dong-Ping; Li, Cheng-Hui; Zhou, Xin-Hui; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zuo, Jing-Lin; You, Xiao-Zeng
      Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (6), 2596-2605CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      New coordination polymers, {[Zn(1,2-bimb)(D-ca)]·2H2O}n (1), [Zn(1,3-bimb)(D-ca)]n (2), [Cd(1,3-bimb)(D-ca)]n (3), [Zn(1,4-bimb)(D-ca)]n (4), and {[Cd2(dpys)(D-ca)2(H2O)2]·H2O}n (5), (D-H2ca = D-camphoric acid, 1,2-bimb = 1,2-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, 1,3-bimb = 1,3-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, 1,4-bimb = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, dpys = 4,4'-dipyridylsulfide), were prepd. under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by elemental analyses, IR, vibrational CD, thermogravimetric and x-ray structural analyses. Their structures and properties can be tuned by variable coordination positions and conformations of the auxiliary ligands. Complex 1 features a three-dimensional (3D) supramol. framework with a 1-dimensional (1D)-nanosized channel. Complexes 2 and 3 show acentric 1-dimensional double-stranded chains. The chiral two-dimensional sheet with (4,4) topol. is found in compd. 4. Compd. 5 displays a 1-dimensional ladder-like chain. Photoluminescent properties of 1 and 5 were studied. Compds. 2-5 display a second-order nonlinear optical effect and ferroelec. behaviors.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXlt1WrtrY%253D&md5=b75016615cd56a131b30ac92f4dc2600
      (i) Su, Z.; Fan, J.; Okamura, T.; Sun, W. Y.; Ueyama, N. Cryst. Growth Des. 2010, 10, 3515
      [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
      17i
      Ligand-directed and pH-controlled assembly of chiral 3d-3d heterometallic metal-organic frameworks
      Su, Zhi; Fan, Jian; Okamura, Taka-aki; Sun, Wei-Yin; Ueyama, Norikazu
      Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (8), 3515-3521CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
      Use of unsym. ligand 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylic acid (1,2,4-H3BTC) and controlling the reaction pH value enabled isolation of two novel chiral 3d-3d heterometallic complexes [Zn2Co(tib)3(H2O)5][Zn6(tib)2(1,2,4-BTC)6]·12.7H2O (1) and [ZnCo(tib)(1,2,4-BTC)(H2O)2]Cl·3H2O (2) [tib = 1,3,5-tris(1-imidazolyl)benzene]. Comparative study revealed that the use of sym. ligand 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (1,3,5-H3BTC) resulted one achiral 3d-3d heterometallic complex [ZnCo(tib)(1,3,5-BTC)Cl] (3) with 3-dimensional structure. Complex 1 is a 2-dimensional network with cationic and anionic layers arranged alternately, while 2 is a 3-dimensional framework with rare 1-dimensional helical water chains. Also, complex 1 displays ferroelec. behavior with a remnant elec. polarization (Pr) of ∼0.177 μC/cm2 and an elec. coercive field (Ec) of ∼17.68 kV/cm.
      >> More from SciFinder ®
      https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXns1Cmtbs%253D&md5=04960d4b43af160c7aa1d2a5c9059ff1

      1. 1
        (a) Pang, J.; Marcotte, E. J. P.; Seward, C.; Brown, R. S.; Wang, S. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2001, 40, 4042
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1a
        A blue luminescent star-shaped ZnII complex that can detect benzene
        Pang, Jun; Marcotte, Eric J.-P.; Seward, Corey; Brown, R. Stephen; Wang, Suning
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2001), 40 (21), 4042-4045CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
        The authors synthesized a new class of blue luminescent org. star-shaped mols.-that contain either 7-azaindolyl or 2,2'-dipyridylamino groups. Some of the new star-shaped mols. have been found to be promising blue emitters in electroluminescence devices. Most interestingly, the authors found that the new star-shaped mols. are capable of coordinating to various metal centers, which results in the formation of novel coordination compds. Some of these new compds. are capable of selectively detecting specific small mols. by functioning as fluorescent sensors, an example of which, the ZnII complex of 1,3,5-tris[p-(2,2'-dipyridylamino)phenyl]benzene (TPDPB, I) is described herein. The TPDPB ligand displays a broad emission band at λmax = 386 nm in soln. (CH2Cl2) and at λmax = 400 nm in the solid state when irradiated by UV light. The quantum efficiency of TPDPB in soln. was detd. to be 0.19. relative to that of 9.10-diphenylanthracence. The star-shaped complex, [(ZnCl2)3(TPDPB)] (1) was obtained from the reaction of TPDPB with three equiv. of ZnCl2 in CH2Cl2/CH3OH soln. Complex I1 is stable toward air and moisture in soln. and in the solid state and its fluorescence emission shows an unusually high selectivity to benzene vapor.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD3MXosV2jt7w%253D&md5=7d76ff225d005d97f3fbd6cf9e93fdf3
        (b) Liang, K.; Zheng, H. G.; Song, Y. L.; Lappert, M. F.; Li, Y. Z.; Xin, X. Q.; Huang, Z. X.; Chen, J. T.; Lu, S. F. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2004, 43, 5776
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1b
        Coordination polymers: Self-assembly of interpenetrating coordination nets formed from interpenetrating cationic and anionic three-dimensional diamondoid cluster coordination polymers
        Liang, Kai; Zheng, Hegen; Song, Yinglin; Lappert, Michael E.; Li, Yizhi; Xin, Xinquan; Huang, Zixiang; Chen, Jiutong; Lu, Shaofang
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2004), 43 (43), 5776-5779CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Tetrathiometalates [WS4]2- are the nodal building blocks in a new kind of heterometallic interpenetrating three-dimensional cluster coordination polymer, {[WS4Cu4(4,4'-bipy)4][WS4Cu4I4(4,4'-bipy)2]·4H2O}n (4,4'-bipy = 4,4'-bipyridine), that has interesting nonlinear optical properties. The polymer exhibits optical self-focusing behavior and reverse saturable absorption effects.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXhtVejt7%252FI&md5=6b084d9c41f657d3e4d6d5d1901c985d
        (c) Huang, Y. Q.; Ding, B.; Song, H. B.; Zhao, B.; Ren, P.; Cheng, P.; Wang, H. G.; Liao, D. Z.; Yan, S. P. Chem. Commun. 2006, 4906
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1c
        A novel 3D porous metal-organic framework based on trinuclear cadmium clusters as a promising luminescent material exhibiting tunable emissions between UV and visible wavelengths
        Huang, Yong-Quan; Ding, Bin; Song, Hai-Bin; Zhao, Bin; Ren, Peng; Cheng, Peng; Wang, Hong-Gen; Liao, Dai-Zheng; Yan, Shi-Ping
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2006), (47), 4906-4908CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A novel 3-dimensional porous MOF built with trinuclear cadmium clusters exhibiting rhombohedral topol., {[Cd3L6](BF4)2(SiF6)(OH)2·13.5H2O}n (L = 2,6-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)pyridine), was synthesized and characterized by x-ray crystallog. and IR and luminescence spectroscopy. This MOF is a promising luminescent material that can give tunable emissions between UV and visible wavelengths by controlling the no. of guest H2O mols.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xht1ClsLjI&md5=9e84adec9df6329ec8d159b263738195
        (d) Bauer, C. A.; Timofeeva, T. V.; Settersten, T. B.; Patterson, B. D.; Liu, V. H.; Simmons, B. A.; Allendorf, M. D. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2007, 129, 7136
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1d
        Influence of Connectivity and Porosity on Ligand-Based Luminescence in Zinc Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Bauer, Christina A.; Timofeeva, Tatiana V.; Settersten, Thomas B.; Patterson, Brian D.; Liu, Vincent H.; Simmons, Blake A.; Allendorf, Mark D.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2007), 129 (22), 7136-7144CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Applications of metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) require close correlation between their structure and function. The authors describe the prepn. and characterization of two Zn MOFs based on a flexible and emissive linker mol., stilbene, which retains its luminescence within these solid materials. Reaction of trans-4,4'-stilbenedicarboxylic acid (H2L) and zinc nitrate in DMF yielded a dense 2-dimensional network, Zn3L3(DMF)2 (1), featuring Zn in both octahedral and tetrahedral coordination environments connected by trans-stilbene links. Similar reaction in N,N-diethylformamide (DEF) at higher temps., followed by replacement of solvent in workup, resulted in a porous, 3-dimensional framework structure, Zn4OL3·(DMF)(CHCl3) (2). This framework consists of two interpenetrating cubic lattices, each featuring basic Zn carboxylate vertexes joined by trans-stilbene, analogous to the isoreticular MOF (IRMOF) series. The optical properties of both 1 and 2 correlate with the local ligand environments obsd. in the crystal structures. Steady-state and time-resolved spectroscopic measurements reveal that the stilbene linkers in the dense structure 1 exhibit a small degree of interchromophore coupling. In contrast, the stilbenoid units in 2 display very little interaction in this low-d. 3-dimensional framework, with excitation and emission spectra characteristic of monomeric stilbenes, similar to the dicarboxylic acid in dil. soln. In both cases, the rigidity of the stilbene linker increases upon coordination to the inorg. units through inhibition of torsion about the central ethylene bond, resulting in luminescent crystals with increased emission lifetimes compared to solns. of trans-stilbene. The emission spectrum of 2 depends on the nature of the incorporated solvent mols., suggesting use of this or related materials in sensor applications.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXltlWlurs%253D&md5=d4fb4e7121ad3251fba2c481c1ca2c49
        (e) Zheng, X. L.; Liu, Y.; Pan, M.; Lü, X. Q.; Zhang, J. Y.; Zhao, C. Y.; Tong, Y. X.; Su, C. Y. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2007, 46, 7399
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1e
        Bright blue-emitting Ce3+ complexes with encapsulating polybenzimidazole solid state tripodal ligands as potential electroluminescent devices
        Zheng, Xiang-Li; Liu, Yu; Pan, Mei; Lu, Xing-Qiang; Zhang, Jian-Yong; Zhao, Cun-Yuan; Tong, Ye-Xiang; Su, Cheng-Yong
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2007), 46 (39), 7399-7403CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Sky-blue research: Studies of the photo-luminescence and electroluminescence of Ce3 coordination complexes with tripodal benzimidazole ligands reveals effective energy transfer from both metal- and ligand-based transitions and efficient blue metal-centered emission. A blue-emitting LED device was fabricated using one such Ce complex, suggesting their potential application as light-emitting materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXhtF2gtrrP&md5=4138a947029b6623fe0db7961da837d0
        (f) Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhaktaa, R. K.; Houka, R. J. T. Chem. Soc. Rev. 2009, 38, 1330
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1f
        Luminescent metal-organic frameworks
        Allendorf, M. D.; Bauer, C. A.; Bhakta, R. K.; Houk, R. J. T.
        Chemical Society Reviews (2009), 38 (5), 1330-1352CODEN: CSRVBR; ISSN:0306-0012. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A review; metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) display a wide range of luminescent behaviors resulting from the multifaceted nature of their structure. In this crit. review we discuss the origins of MOF luminosity, which include the linker, the coordinated metal ions, antenna effects, excimer and exciplex formation, and guest mols. The literature describing these effects is comprehensively surveyed, including a categorization of each report according to the type of luminescence obsd. Finally, we discuss potential applications of luminescent MOFs. This review will be of interest to researchers and synthetic chemists attempting to design luminescent MOFs, and those engaged in the extension of MOFs to applications such as chem., biol., and radiation detection, medical imaging, and electro-optical devices.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXkvVamurg%253D&md5=9219edb8997dd29d5f61edbe8e99797d
        (g) Eberle, U.; Felderhoff, M.; Schüth, F. Angew. Chem., Int. Ed. 2009, 48, 6608
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1g
        Chemical and Physical Solutions for Hydrogen Storage
        Eberle, Ulrich; Felderhoff, Michael; Schueth, Ferdi
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2009), 48 (36), 6608-6630CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        A review. Hydrogen is a promising energy carrier in future energy systems. However, storage of hydrogen is a substantial challenge, esp. for applications in vehicles with fuel cells that use proton exchange membranes. Different methods for hydrogen storage are discussed, including high-pressure and cryogenic-liq. storage, adsorptive storage on high-surface-area adsorbents, chem. storage in metal hydrides and complex hydrides, and storage in boranes. For the latter chem. solns., reversible options and hydrolytic release of hydrogen with off-board regeneration are both possible. Reforming of liq. hydrogen-contg. compds. is also a possible means of hydrogen generation. The advantages and disadvantages of the different systems are compared.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXhtVGrtrfP&md5=836ffb2ef7027debfc260cae9d4e3fa6
        (h) Gu, Z. G.; Fang, H. C.; Yin, P. Y.; Tong, L.; Ying, Y.; Hu, S. J.; Li, W. S.; Cai, Y. P. Cryst. Growth Des. 2011, 11, 2220
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        1h
        A Family of Three-Dimensional Lanthanide-Zinc Heterometal-Organic Frameworks from 4,5-Imidazoledicarboxylate and Oxalate
        Gu, Zhi-Gang; Fang, Hua-Cai; Yin, Pei-Yi; Tong, Long; Ying, Yin; Hu, She-Jun; Li, Wei-Shan; Cai, Yue-Peng
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (6), 2220-2227CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        A family of lanthanide-Zn coordination polymers with two different types of three-dimensional (3-D) frameworks based on 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid and oxalic acid, namely, {[Ln2(H2O)2Zn4(H2O)4(ImDC)4(ox)]·6H2O}n (Ln = La (1), Nd (2), Sm (3), Eu (4), and H3ImDC = 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid, H2ox = oxalic acid) and {[Ln2(H2O)4Zn4(H2O)4(ImDC)4(ox)]·MeOH·2H2O}n (Ln = Eu (4'), Gd (5), Dy (6), Ho (7), Er (8), Yb (9), and Lu (10)), were successfully constructed under certain conditions and characterized by elemental anal., IR, thermogravimetric (TG), and single-crystal x-ray diffraction. Compds. 1-4 (structure I) are isomorphous 3-dimensional coordination frameworks contg. two-dimensional (2-D) [Zn2(ImDC)2] layers and 1-dimensional (1-D) Ln2(μ2-O)2(ox) sine wave-like chains with 1-dimensional square channels, while 4'-10 coordination polymers (structure II) are also isomorphous and feature 3-dimensional pillar-layered coordination frameworks constructed from 2-dimensional Zn-carboxylate [Zn2(ImDC)2] layers and Ln2(ox) pillars with 1-dimensional flat channels. The structural variation from I to II with the Eu ion as a crit. point, in which two types of Eu complexes 4 and 4' can reversibly transform into each other, may be attributed to the lanthanide contraction effect. Meanwhile, the adsorption and photoluminescent properties of the compds. are also studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3MXlsVKks7o%253D&md5=31b94adaabd9b53f16d08a5bdcd50385
        (i) Tan, C. R.; Yang, S. H.; Champness, N. R.; Lin, X.; Blake, A. J.; Lewis, W.; Schröder, M. Chem. Commun. 2011, 47, 4487

        1i
        High capacity gas storage by a 4,8-connected metal-organic polyhedral framework
        Tan, Chenrong; Yang, Sihai; Champness, Neil R.; Lin, Xiang; Blake, Alexander J.; Lewis, William; Schroeder, Martin
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (15), 4487-4489CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        The polyhedral complex [Cu4L(H2O)4]solv (NOTT-140, H8L = octacarboxylic acid I) shows a 4,8-connected structure of rare scu topol. comprising octahedral and cuboctahedral cages; desolvated NOTT-140a shows a total CO2 uptake of 314.6 cm3 (STP) cm-3 at 20 bar, 293 K, and a total H2 uptake of 6.0% at 20 bar, 77 K.
