        (a) Brechin, E. K.; Harris, S. G.; Harrison, A.; Parsons, S.; Whittaker, A. G.; Winpenny, R. E. P. Chem. Commun. 1997, 653
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2a
        Synthesis, structural characterization and preliminary magnetic studies of a tetracosanuclear cobalt coordination complex
        Brechin, Euan K.; Harris, Steven G.; Harrison, Andrew; Parsons, Simon; Whittaker, A. Gavin; Winpenny, Richard E. P.
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge) (1997), (7), 653-654CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Reaction of CoCl2 with Na(mhp) (Hmhp = 2-methyl-6-hydroxypyridine) in MeOH gave [Co24(μ3-OH)14(μ-OH)4(μ3-OMe)2(μ3-Cl)2Cl4(mhp)22] (1), which was characterized by x-ray crystallog. (1.C4H8O2: triclinic, space group P‾1, R1 = 0.0572). This highest nuclearity complex contg. cobalt consists of ccp. planes of hydroxide, methoxide or chloride anions and bridging cobalt(II) centers. Preliminary magnetic studies indicate a high-spin ground state and the possibility of superparamagnetic behavior.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaK2sXislGlu7k%253D&md5=056a6a8231ff3266807187a587ea1e74
        (b) Lu, J. Y.; Lawandy, M. A.; Li, J. Inorg. Chem. 1999, 38, 2695
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2b
        A New Type of Two-Dimensional Metal Coordination Systems: Hydrothermal Synthesis and Properties of the First Oxalate-bpy Mixed-Ligand Framework ∞2[M(ox)(bpy)] (M = Fe(II), Co(II), Ni(II), Zn(II); ox = C2O42-; bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine)
        Lu, Jack Y.; Lawandy, Michael A.; Li, Jing; Yuen, Tan; Lin, C. L.
        Inorganic Chemistry (1999), 38 (11), 2695-2704CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        A new family of two-dimensional metal coordination polymers with the general formula ∞2[M(ox)(bpy)] (M = Fe(II), Co(II), Ni(II), Zn(II); ox = C2O42-; bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine) were designed and synthesized via hydrothermal routes. Quant. yields were obtained in all cases. The title compds. ∞2[Fe(ox)(bpy)] (I), ∞2[Co(ox)(bpy)] (II), ∞2[Ni(ox)(bpy)] (III), and ∞2[Zn(ox)(bpy)] (IV) represent the 1st coordination network structure constructed by bridging oxalate and 4,4'-bpy mixed ligands. I-IV are isostructural and belong to the orthorhombic crystal system, space group Immm. The noninterpenetrated structure contains octahedral metal centers coordinated by two oxalate and two bpy ligands to form a two-dimensional layered network. Within each layer, relatively large rectangular voids are formed by four adjacent metal centers and the ligands bonded to them. The approx. dimensions of these cavities are 4 × 7 × 10 Å in the composite three-dimensional structures. Magnetic susceptibility and field-dependent magnetization measurements revealed spontaneous magnetic ordering with transition temps. of 12, 13, and 26 K for I, II, and III, resp. The types of ordering are interpreted as the antiferromagnetic kind with certain canting structures. The μeff values yielded from the fitting of χ(T) indicate the high spin states of M ions in all three compds. The origin of the magnetic ordering in these compds. may be attributed to the strong exchange interactions between the M ions at the octahedral sites through the bridging oxalate mols. along the a-axis. Possible interchain coupling along the [011] direction is also considered. TGA studies indicate that all four compds. are thermally stable up to 290° (the on-set temp. of wt. losses for I, 290°; II, 340°; III, 350°; and IV, 290°).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADyaK1MXivVWnu7s%253D&md5=288ccb9792f2e63c8620e54afaceeabd
        (c) Kumagai, H.; Kepert, C. J.; Kurmoo, M. Inorg. Chem. 2002, 41, 3410
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2c
        Construction of Hydrogen-Bonded and Coordination-Bonded Networks of Cobalt(II) with Pyromellitate: Synthesis, Structures, and Magnetic Properties
        Kumagai, Hitoshi; Kepert, Cameron J.; Kurmoo, Mohamedally
        Inorganic Chemistry (2002), 41 (13), 3410-3422CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Synthesis (hydrothermal and metathesis), characterization (UV-visible, IR, TG/DTA), single-crystal x-ray structures, and magnetic properties of three Co(II)-pyromellitate complexes, purple [Co2(pm)]n (1), red [Co2(pm)(H2O)4]n·2nH2O (2), and pink [Co(H2O)6](H2pm) (3) (H4pm = pyromellitic acid (1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid)), are described. 1 Consists of 1-dimensional chains of edge-sharing CoO6 octahedra that are connected into layers via O-C-O bridges. The layers are held together by the pyromellitate (pm4-) backbone to give a three-dimensional structure with each ligand participating in an unprecedented 12 coordination bonds (Co-O) to 10 Co atoms. 2 Consists of a three-dimensional coordination network possessing cavities in which unbound H2O mols. reside. This highly sym. network comprises eight coordinate bonds (Co-O) between O atoms of pm4- to six trans-Co(H2O)2. 3 Possesses a H-bonded sandwich structure assocg. layers of [Co(H2O)6]2+ and planar H2pm2-. The IR spectra, reflecting the different coordination modes and charges of the pyromellitate, are presented and discussed. The magnetic properties of 1 indicate complex behavior with three ground states (collinear and canted antiferromagnetism and field-induced ferromagnetism). Above the Neel temp. (TN) of 16 K it displays paramagnetism with short-range ferromagnetic interactions (Θ = +16.4 K, μeff = 4.90 μB per Co). Below TN a weak spontaneous magnetization is obsd. at 12.8 K in low applied fields (H < 100 Oe). At higher fields (H > 1000 Oe) metamagnetic behavior is obsd. Two types of hysteresis loops are obsd.; one centered about zero field and the 2nd about the metamagnetic crit. field. The crit. field and the hysteresis width increase as the temp. is lowered. The heat capacity data suggest that 1 has a 2-dimensional or 3-dimensional magnetic lattice, and the derived magnetic entropy data confirm an anisotropic seff = 1/2 for the Co(II) ion. Magnetic susceptibility data indicate that 2 and 3 are paramagnets.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38XktVaiurc%253D&md5=2eed48495ad4dc71ff2f7ea72f582402
        (d) Cao, R.; Shi, Q.; Sun, D. F.; Hong, M. C.; Bi, W. H.; Zhao, Y. J. Inorg. Chem. 2002, 41, 6161
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2d
        Syntheses and Characterizations of Copper(II) Polymeric Complexes Constructed from 1,2,4,5-Benzenetetracarboxylic Acid
        Cao, Rong; Shi, Qian; Sun, Daofeng; Hong, Maochun; Bi, Wenghua; Zhao, Yingjun
        Inorganic Chemistry (2002), 41 (23), 6161-6168CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Four polymeric complexes with rectangular grids or channels, [Cu2(btec)(H2O)4·2H2O]n (2), [Cu2(btec)4/4{Cu(Hbtec)2/2(4,4'-Hbpy)(H2O)2}2·4H2O]n (3), [Cu2(btec)(hmt)(H2O)4·8H2O]n (4), and [Cu3(btec)(OH)2]n (5), were designed and constructed from Cu(II) ion and 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid along with auxiliary ligands (H4btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, 4,4'-Hbpy = monoprotonated 4,4'-bipyridine, and hmt = hexamethylenetetramine). Complexes 2, 3, and 4 have rectangular pores with the size of 6.5 Å × 4.5 Å, 6 Å × 7 Å, and 10.1 Å × 11.8 Å, resp., while 5 has a channel of 7.4 Å × 9.6 Å. The complexes show interesting magnetic properties due to the different coordination modes of the carboxylate groups and the presence of auxiliary ligands. On lowering the temp., the magnetic interactions in 2 are changed from antiferromagnetic to ferromagnetic. For 3, the antiferromagnetic interactions weaken sharply at low temp. Complex 4 shows ferromagnetic interactions while 5 is antiferromagnetic.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38XotVWqsbs%253D&md5=804549b30dea12c66157846b10c252e5
        (e) Gavrilenko, K. S.; Punin, S. V.; Cador, O.; Golhen, S.; Ouahab, L.; Pavlishchuk, V. V. J. Am. Chem. Soc. 2005, 127, 12246
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2e
        In Situ Generation of Carboxylate: An Efficient Strategy for a One-Pot Synthesis of Homo- and Heterometallic Polynuclear Complexes
        Gavrilenko, Konstantin S.; Punin, Sergey V.; Cador, Olivier; Golhen, Stephane; Ouahab, Lahcene; Pavlishchuk, Vitaly V.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2005), 127 (35), 12246-12253CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        An efficient strategy for synthesis of a wide range of homo- and heterometallic polynuclear complexes is proposed. The synthesis protocol consists of a two-step 1-pot reaction. The 1st step is the in situ generation of carboxylate anions via oxidn. of arom. aldehydes by metal nitrates in air. The aldehydes act as solvents and are also involved in redox processes. Solns. contg. solely transition metal cations and arom. carboxylates were obtained following this procedure. The 2nd step is a tunable a la carte formation of various polynuclear carboxylato complexes from solns. obtained at the former stage upon addn. of different solvents. The polarity and donor properties of the solvents play a key role in detn. of the nuclearities of the complexes. Hydrolytic processes can induce the formation of oxo- or hydroxo-bridges inside the polynuclear core as well. Complexes of various nuclearities were obtained: from discrete tri-, hexa-, or octanuclear units to 1-dimensional polymers. This protocol can be adapted with disconcerting simplicity to the synthesis of heterometallic species with similar mol. structures to their homometallic analogs starting from stoichiometric mixt. of metal nitrates under the same reaction conditions. Detailed description of synthesis and the mol. structure of one representative complex for each series are presented. The temp. dependence of magnetic susceptibility of the heterometallic 1-dimensional MnCo chain reveals typical behavior of a ferrimagnetic chain. The low-temp. studies on single crystals show significant Ising type magnetic anisotropy.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXns1aitr4%253D&md5=a6f9b26c234af47411582822f3589efe
        (f) Pan, Z. R.; Zheng, H. G.; Wang, T. W.; Song, Y.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Batten, S. R. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 9528
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2f
        Hydrothermal Synthesis, Structures, and Physical Properties of Four New Flexible Multicarboxylate Ligands-Based Compounds
        Pan, Zhaorui; Zheng, Hegen; Wang, Tianwei; Song, You; Li, Yizhi; Guo, Zijian; Batten, Stuart R.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2008), 47 (20), 9528-9536CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Four new compds. of partially or wholly deprotonated 5,5'-(1,4-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L1) and 5,5'-(1,3-phenylenebis(methylene))bis(oxy)diisophthalic acid (H4L2), {[Co(L1)0.5]·(H2O)2}n (1), {[Mn(L1)0.5]·(H2O)2}n (2), {[Cu(H2L1)](μ2-bipy)}n (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridyl) (3), and {[Zn2(L2)].H2O}n (4) were synthesized in the presence or absence of auxiliary bipy ligand. Their structures were detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction anal. and further characterized by elemental anal., IR spectra, and TGA. Compds. 1 and 2 are isostructural and possess three-dimensional (3D) networks. In compd. 3, multicarboxylate ligands and bipy ligands link Cu centers to generate a two-dimensional (2D) sheet structure which is further connected by intermol. hydrogen bonds to form a 3-dimensional supramol. structure. In compd. 4, the Zn centers are connected by L24- anions to generate a 3-dimensional framework. Magnetic susceptibility measurements indicate that compds. 1 and 2 exhibit antiferromagnetic coupling between adjacent Co(II) ions and Mn(II) ions. The photoluminescent properties of the free H4L1 and H4L2 ligands and compd. 4 were studied in the solid state at room temp. Both ligands and compd. 4 exhibit strong violet emissions. Compared with the fluorescent emission of the ligand, the emission of 4 is red shifted and enhanced.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhtFGntr3J&md5=78d3e89f95eab133b052beb754125dbf
        (g) Bi, Y. F.; Wang, X. T.; Wang, B. W.; Liao, W. P.; Wang, X. F.; Zhang, H. J.; Gao, S.; Lia, D. Q. Dalton Trans. 2009, 2250
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        2g
        Two MnII2LnIII4 (Ln = Gd, Eu) hexanuclear compounds of p-tert-butylsulfinylcalix[4]arene
        Bi, Yanfeng; Wang, Xiu-Teng; Wang, Bing-Wu; Liao, Wuping; Wang, Xiaofei; Zhang, Hongjie; Gao, Song; Li, Deqian
        Dalton Transactions (2009), (12), 2250-2254CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Two 3d-4f heterometallic compds. [Mn2Ln4(L)4(H2O)2] (Ln = Gd, Eu; H4L = p-tert-butylsulfinylcalix[4]arene) were synthesized by the solvothermal method and crystallog. characterized as hinged double-dumbbell-like subunits in which two perpendicular dumbbell entities were constructed by an in-between isosceles triangle MnIILnIII2, and two tail-to-tail calixarene mols., and hinged by the lanthanide-sulfinyl group bonding. The magnetic properties of the title compds. were examd.

        Chemical Reviews (Washington, DC, United States) (2010), 110 (8), 4606-4655CODEN: CHREAY; ISSN:0009-2665. (American Chemical Society)
        A review, including the design of MOFs for catalysis and evaluation of its potential as catalyst as well as catalysis by MOFs with active metal sites, with reactive functional groups, and MOFs as host matrixes or nanometric reaction cavities.

        A metalloporphyrin functionalized metal-organic framework for selective oxidization of styrene
        Xie, Ming-Hua; Yang, Xiu-Li; Wu, Chuan-De
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2011), 47 (19), 5521-5523CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A functional metal-org. framework [Cd1.25Pd-H1.5TCPP(H2O)] assembled from Pd-porphyrin (TCPP = tetra(4-carboxyphenyl)porphyrin) building blocks and Cd(II) connecting nodes presents interesting topol. network structure, high framework stability and interesting catalytic property for the selective oxidn. of styrene.

        3a
        A Homochiral Porous Metal-Organic Framework for Highly Enantioselective Heterogeneous Asymmetric Catalysis
        Wu, Chuan-De; Hu, Aiguo; Zhang, Lin; Lin, Wenbin
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2005), 127 (25), 8940-8941CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A homochiral porous noninterpenetrating metal-org. framework (MOF) was constructed by linking infinite 1D [Cd(μ-Cl)2]n zigzag chains with axially chiral bipyridine bridging ligands contg. orthogonal secondary functional groups. The secondary chiral dihydroxy groups accessible via the large open channels in the MOF were used to generate a heterogeneous asym. catalyst for the addn. of diethyzinc to arom. aldehydes to afford chiral secondary alcs. at ≤ 93% enantiomeric excess. Control expts. with dendritic arom. aldehydes of different sizes indicate that the heterogeneous asym. catalyst derived from the MOF is both highly active and enantioselective as a result of the creation of readily accessible, uniform active catalyst sites inside the porous MOF.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2MXkslGju7k%253D&md5=be949b8f1137bf47943fc56138ccbec3
        (b) Alaerts, L.; Seguin, E.; Poelman, H.; Starzyk, F. T.; Jacobs, P. A.; Vos, D. E. D. Chem.—Eur. J. 2006, 12, 7353
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3b
        Probing the Lewis acidity and catalytic activity of the metal-organic framework [Cu3(btc)2] (BTC=benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate)
        Alaerts, Luc; Seguin, Etienne; Poelman, Hilde; Thibault-Starzyk, Frederic; Jacobs, Pierre A.; De Vos, Dirk E.
        Chemistry - A European Journal (2006), 12 (28), 7353-7363CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        An optimized procedure was designed for the prepn. of the microporous metal-org. framework (MOF) [Cu3(btc)2] (BTC=benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate). The cryst. material was characterized by X-ray diffraction, optical microscopy, SEM, XPS, N2 sorption, thermogravimetry, and IR spectroscopy of adsorbed CO. CO adsorbs on a small no. of Cu2O impurities, and particularly on the free CuII coordination sites in the framework. [Cu3(btc)2] is a highly selective Lewis acid catalyst for the isomerization of terpene derivs., such as the rearrangement of α-pinene oxide to campholenic aldehyde and the cyclization of citronellal to isopulegol. By using the ethylene ketal of 2-bromopropiophenone as a test substrate, it was demonstrated that the active sites in [Cu3(btc)2] are hard Lewis acids. Catalyst stability, re-usability, and heterogeneity are critically assessed.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XhtV2ru7jN&md5=c3e40b361ab1035dc02abe619570b715
        (c) Cho, S. H.; Ma, B.; Nguyen, S. T.; Hupp, J. T.; Albrecht-Schmitt, T. E. Chem. Commun. 2006, 2563
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        3c
        A metal-organic framework material that functions as an enantioselective catalyst for olefin epoxidation
        Cho, So-Hye; Ma, Baoqing; Nguyen, SonBinh T.; Hupp, Joseph T.; Albrecht-Schmitt, Thomas E.
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2006), (24), 2563-2565CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A new microporous metal-org. framework compd. featuring chiral (salen)Mn struts is highly effective as an asym. catalyst for olefin epoxidn., yielding enantiomeric excesses that rival those of the free mol. analog. Framework confinement of the manganese salen entity enhances catalyst stability, imparts substrate size selectivity, and permits catalyst sepn. and reuse.

        3e
        Preparation, Structures, and Photocatalytic Properties of Three New Uranyl-Organic Assembly Compounds
        Liao, Zuo-Lei; Li, Guo-Dong; Bi, Ming-Hui; Chen, Jie-Sheng
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2008), 47 (11), 4844-4853CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Three new uranyl-org. coordination polymers [(UO2)8(NDC)12](4,4'-bipyH2)3(4,4'-bipyH)2(4,4'-bipy) (1), (UO2)3O[Ag(2,2'-bipy)2]2(NDC)3 (2), and (UO2)2(NDC)2(2,2'-bipy)2 (3), where NDC = 1,4-naphthalenedicarboxylate and bipy = bipyridine, were prepd. in hydrothermal conditions. Both 1 and 2 possess a 2-dimensional structure while 3 is composed of 1-dimensional zigzag chains. In 1 there are mononuclear pentagonal-bipyramidal U-O polyhedra and 1-dimensional channels filled with 4,4'-bipy mols., whereas in 2 there are mononuclear hexagonal-bipyramidal U-O polyhedra and tetranuclear pentagonal-bipyramidal U-O clusters which form 2-dimensional channels with occluded [Ag(2,2'-bipy)2]+ counterions. In 3 both the NDC and the bipy ligands coordinate to uranyl centers, leading to hexagonal-bipyramidal polyhedra which are connected to form 1-dimensional zigzag chains. Under UV or visible irradn., 1 and 2 degrade rhodamine B with similar efficiency. The correlation between photocatalytic reaction rate and O2 concn. for 1 and 2 also was elucidated. Crystal data: 1, triclinic, space group P‾1, a 11.037(2), b 15.126(3), c 15.660(3) Å, α 62.05(3), β 72.26(3), γ 82.05(3)°, and Z = 2; 2, triclinic, space group P‾1, a 14.161(3), b 15.122(3), c 18.212(4) Å, α 85.73(3), β 76.99(3), γ 67.32(3)°, and Z = 2; 3, monoclinic, space group P21/n, a 10.7976(18), b 31.501(6), c 11.590(2) Å, β 97.609(4)°, and Z = 4.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        3g
        Cyano-Bridged Homochiral Heterometallic Helical Complexes: Synthesis, Structures, Magnetic and Dielectric Properties
        Zheng, Xiao-Dan; Hua, Yan-Long; Xiong, Ren-Gen; Ge, Jia-Zhen; Lu, Tong-Bu
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (1), 302-310CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        The reaction of the chiral macrocyclic compd. [Ni(SS-L)](ClO4)2 with Na2[Fe(CN)5NO] in acetonitrile/water gave {[Ni(SS-L)][cis-Fe(CN)5NO]}n (Δ-2) and {[Ni(SS-L)][trans-Fe(CN)5NO]}n (Λ-3), and the reaction of chiral [Ni(RR-L)](ClO4)2 with Na2[Fe(CN)5NO] gave the corresponding {[Ni(RR-L)][cis-Fe(CN)5NO]}n (Λ-2) and {[Ni(RR-L)][trans-Fe(CN)5NO]}n (Δ-3), while the reaction of racemic [Ni(rac-L)](ClO4)2 with Na2[Fe(CN)5NO] generated five supramol. isomers of one achiral {[Ni(rac-L)][cis-Fe(CN)5NO]}2 (meso-1) and four homochiral Δ-2/Λ-2 and Δ-3/Λ-3 (L = 5,5,7,12,12,14-hexamethyl-1,4,8,11-tetraazacyclotetradecane). In meso-1, a pair of enantiomers of [Ni(SS-L)]2+ and [Ni(RR-L)]2+ are bridged by two [Fe(CN)5NO]2- through two cis cyano groups to form a [2 + 2] type of discrete mol. square. In Δ-2/Λ-2, the homochiral [Ni(SS-L)]2+/[Ni(RR-L)]2+ cations are alternately bridged by [Fe(CN)5NO]2- anions through two cis cyano groups to produce one-dimensional (1D) homochiral right-handed and left-handed helical chains of Δ-2 and Λ-2, resp. In Δ-3/Λ-3, the homochiral [Ni(RR-L)]2+/[Ni(SS-L)]2+ cations are alternately bridged by [Fe(CN)5NO]2- anions through two trans cyano groups to produce 1D homochiral right-handed and left-handed helical chains in Δ-3 and Λ-3, resp. Their thermal stability, CD spectra, magnetic and dielec. properties were also investigated.

        Hydrogen adsorption in the nanoporous metal-benzene dicarboxylate M(OH)(O2C-C6H4-CO2) (M = Al3+, Cr3+), MIL-53
        Ferey, Gerard; Latroche, Michel; Serre, Christian; Millange, Franck; Loiseau, Thierry; Percheron-Guegan, Annick
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2003), (24), 2976-2977CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        H adsorption was studied in the nanoporous metal-benzene dicarboxylate M(OH)(O2C-C6H4-CO2) (M = Al3+, Cr3+). These solids have H storage capacities of 3.8 and 3.1% resp. when loaded at 77 K under 1.6 MPa.

        4b
        Hydrogen Sorption in Functionalized Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Rowsell, Jesse L. C.; Millward, Andrew R.; Park, Kyo Sung; Yaghi, Omar M.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2004), 126 (18), 5666-5667CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Five porous metal-org. frameworks based on linking zinc oxide clusters with benzene-1,4-dicarboxylate, naphthalene-2,6-dicarboxylate, 4,5,9,10-tetrahydropyrene-2,7-dicarboxylate, 2,3,5,6-tetramethylbenzene-1,4-dicarboxylate, or benzene-1,3,5-tris(4-benzoate) were synthesized in gram-scale quantities to measure their hydrogen uptake properties. Hydrogen adsorption isotherms measured at 77 K show a distinct dependence of uptake on the nature of the link. At 1 atm, the materials sorb between 4.2 and 9.3 mols. of H2 per formula unit. The results imply a trend in hydrogen uptake with the no. of rings in the org. moiety.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXjt1ajur0%253D&md5=e58df7476eb6721e8c16cfaf80d0932d
        (c) Maji, T. K.; Mostafa, G.; Chang, H. C.; Kitagawa, S. Chem. Commun. 2005, 2436
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        4c
        Porous lanthanide-organic framework with zeolite-like topology
        Maji, Tapas Kumar; Mostafa, Golam; Chang, Ho-Chol; Kitagawa, Susumu
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2005), (19), 2436-2438CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Two novel isomorphous porous frameworks of Ln(III), {[Ln2(imidc)2(H2O)3](H2O)}n, [Ln = Gd(III) (1) and Er(III) (2)] were synthesized hydrothermally using multifunctional 4,5-imidazoledicarboxylic acid (H3imidc) as a connector. Both complexes were characterized by their sorption and magnetic properties, and 1 by x-ray crystallog. They have a zeolite-like network topol. which can provide another form upon dehydration, and exhibit selective adsorption properties for H2O over N2, CO2 and MeOH.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        4d
        Exceptional H2 Saturation Uptake in Microporous Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Wong-Foy, Antek G.; Matzger, Adam J.; Yaghi, Omar M.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2006), 128 (11), 3494-3495CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        Satn. H2 uptake in a series of microporous metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) has been measured at 77 K. Satn. pressures vary between 25 and 80 bar across the series, with MOF-177 showing the highest uptake on a gravimetric basis (7.5 wt %) and IRMOF-20 showing the highest uptake on a volumetric basis at 34 g/L. These results demonstrate that max. H2 storage capacity in MOFs correlates well to surface area, and that feasible volumetric uptakes can be realized even in highly porous materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28XhvVCjsr8%253D&md5=f6d94bff4ebfd39eedeec1e04573a2e4

        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        4e
        High H2 adsorption by coordination-framework materials
        Lin, Xiang; Jia, Junhua; Zhao, Xuebo; Thomas, K. Mark; Blake, Alexander J.; Walker, Gavin S.; Champness, Neil R.; Hubberstey, Peter; Schroeder, Martin
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2006), 45 (44), 7358-7364CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Three coordination frameworks with different pore sizes were prepd. from CuII salt and carboxylate ligands of various lengths. Comparison of their sorption properties reveals that smaller pores allow higher densities of adsorbed H2, whereas larger pores allow higher max. H2 storage capacities. The structures of the three structural analogs are also reported.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xht1OmsbvI&md5=35c0082804c53403f9f34067950b76a6

        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        4f
        Assembly of metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) based on indium-trimer building blocks: a porous MOF with soc topology and high hydrogen storage
        Liu, Yunling; Eubank, Jarrod F.; Cairns, Amy J.; Eckert, Juergen; Kravtsov, Victor Ch.; Luebke, Ryan; Eddaoudi, Mohamed
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2007), 46 (18), 3278-3283CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        The synthesis and structure of two MOFs based on oxo-bridged trinuclear indium carboxylate clusters are reported. The one MOF has a cubic structure with a CaB6 topol. and the other with an unprecedented soc topol. (soc = square-octahedron). The results obtained indicate that MOFs possessing the characteristics of these two MOFs, combined with the modularity of their construction which allows higher surface areas to be obtained, will permit the attainment of the US DOE target for H2 uptake.

        4g
        Flexible (Breathing) Interpenetrated Metal-Organic Frameworks for CO2 Separation Applications
        Thallapally, Praveen K.; Tian, Jian; Kishan, Motkuri Radha; Fernandez, Carlos A.; Dalgarno, Scott J.; McGrail, Peter B.; Warren, John E.; Atwood, Jerry L.
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2008), 130 (50), 16842-16843CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A breathing 2-fold interpenetrated microporous metal-org. framework was synthesized with a flexible tetrahedral org. linker and Zn2 clusters that sorb CO2 preferably over N2 and H2.

        [NiII2NiIII(μ3-OH)(pba)3(ndc)1.5]·9.5DMA·8.5H2O (I; H2ndc = naphthalene-2,6-dicarboxylic acid; Hpba = 4-pyridin-4-ylbenzoic acid) was prepd.         Freeze Drying Significantly Increases Permanent Porosity and Hydrogen Uptake in 4,4-Connected Metal-Organic Frameworks
        Ma, Liqing; Jin, Athena; Xie, Zhigang; Lin, Wenbin
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2009), 48 (52), 9905-9908, S9905/1-S9905/17CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        4,4-Connected metal-org. frameworks (MOFs) [Cu2(L1)(H2O)2](Et2NCHO)6(H2O)2 [1, L1-H4 = methanetetra(p-benzoic acid)] and [Cu2(L2)(H2O)2](Et2NCHO)14(H2O)5 [2, L2-H4 = methanetetrakis(biphenyl-p-carboxylic acid)] were solvothermally prepd. and crystallog. characterized and permanent porosities were detd. by N2 adsorption and H2 uptake at 77 K. Pre-treatment of the MOFs with a freeze-drying process, esp. ones contg. elongated ligands and large channels, resulted in better preserved structures and enhanced porosity and hydrogen uptake.

        4j
        Solvatochromic Behavior of a Nanotubular Metal-Organic Framework for Sensing Small Molecules
        Lu, Zhen-Zhong; Zhang, Rui; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2011), 133 (12), 4172-4174CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        A nanotubular metal-org. framework (MOF), {[(WS4Cu4)I2(dptz)3]·DMF}n (dptz = 3,6-di(pyridin-4-yl)-1,2,4,5-tetrazine, DMF = DMF) for sensing small solvent mols. is presented. When accommodating different solvent mols. as guests, the resulting inclusion compds. exhibit different colors depending on the solvent guests, and more interestingly, the band gaps of these solvent-included complexes are in linear correlation with the polarity of the guest solvents. The solvent mols. can be sensed by the changes of UV-visible spectra of the corresponding inclusion compds., showing a new way of signal transduction as a new kind of sensor. The sensing by such a MOF occurs within the channel-contg. material rather than on the external surface.

        5a
        Rational design of homochiral solids based on two-dimensional metal carboxylates
        Cui, Yong; Evans, Owen R.; Ngo, Helen L.; White, Peter S.; Lin, Wenbin
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2002), 41 (7), 1159-1162CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH)
        A chiral two-dimensional network is the basis for the structure of a homochiral solid exploiting metal-carboxylate coordination. The synthesis involved enantiopure bridging ligands and metal-org. secondary building units, and resulted in ethoxy-protected BINOL functionalities pointing into the cavities in this cryst. chiral zeolitic material. The cobalt, manganese and nickel-derived complexes of (1S)-6,6'-dichloro-2,2'-diethoxy-1,1'-binaphthalene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid were reported. The cobalt-derived complex of (1R)-6,6'-dichloro-2,2'-diethoxy-1,1'-binaphthalene-4,4'-dicarboxylic acid was also reported; using either the (1S)-isomer or the (1R)-isomer, supramol. enantiomers were obtained.

        5b
        Reticular synthesis and the design of new materials
        Yaghi, Omar M.; O'Keeffe, Michael; Ockwig, Nathan W.; Chae, Hee K.; Eddaoudi, Mohamed; Kim, Jaheon
        Nature (London, United Kingdom) (2003), 423 (6941), 705-714CODEN: NATUAS; ISSN:0028-0836. (Nature Publishing Group)
        A review. The long-standing challenge of designing and constructing new cryst. solid-state materials from mol. building blocks is just beginning to be addressed with success. A conceptual approach that requires the use of secondary building units to direct the assembly of ordered frameworks epitomizes this process: the authors call this approach reticular synthesis. This chem. has yielded materials designed to have predetd. structures, compns. and properties. In particular, highly porous frameworks held together by strong metal-O-C bonds and with exceptionally large surface area and capacity for gas storage were prepd. and their pore metrics systematically varied and functionalized.

        5d
        Silver(I) Complexes of Fixed, Polytopic Bis(pyrazolyl)methane Ligands: Influence of Ligand Geometry on the Formation of Discrete Metallacycles and Coordination Polymers
        Reger, Daniel L.; Watson, Russell P.; Smith, Mark D.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (25), 10077-10087CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Reactions of the arene-linked bis(pyrazolyl)methane ligands m-bis[bis(1-pyrazolyl)methyl]benzene, (m-[CH(pz)2]2C6H4, Lm), p-bis[bis(1-pyrazolyl)methyl]benzene, (p-[CH(pz)2]2C6H4, Lp), and 1,3,5-tris[bis(1-pyrazolyl)methyl]benzene (1,3,5-[CH(pz)2]3C6H3, L3) with AgX salts (pz = 1-pyrazolyl; X = BF4- or PF6-) yield two types of mol. motifs depending on the arrangement of the ligating sites about the central arene ring. Reactions of the m-phenylene-linked Lm with AgBF4 and AgPF6 afford complexes consisting of discrete, metallacyclic dications:[Ag2(μ-Lm)2](BF4)2 (1) and [Ag2(μ-Lm)2](PF6)2 (2). When the p-phenylene-linked Lp is treated with AgBF4 and AgPF6, acyclic, cationic coordination polymers were obtained:{[Ag(μ-Lp)]BF4}∞ (3) and {[Ag(μ-Lp)]PF6}∞ (4). Reaction of the ligand L3, contg. three bis(pyrazolyl)methane units in a meta arrangement, with an equimolar amt. of AgBF4 again yields discrete metallacyclic dications in which one bis(pyrazolyl)methane unit on each ligand remains unbound: [Ag2(μ-L3)2](BF4)2 (5). Treatment of L3 with an excess of AgBF4 affords a polymer of metallacycles, {[Ag3(μ-L3)2](BF4)3}∞ (6), with one of the bis(pyrazolyl)methane units on each ligand bound to a silver cation bridging two metallacycles. The supramol. structures of the silver(I) complexes 1-6 are organized by noncovalent interactions, including weak hydrogen bonding, π-π, and anion-π interactions.

        5e
        Trinuclear Cobalt Based Porous Coordination Polymers Showing Unique Topological and Magnetic Variety upon Different Dicarboxylate-like Ligands
        Luo, Feng; Che, Yun-xia; Zheng, Ji-min
        Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (2), 1066-1071CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        One-pot solvothermal self-assembly is employed to prep. Co3 based porous coordination polymers, viz. (1), [H2NMe2]2[Co3(i.p.)4]·H2O; (2), [H2NMe2]2[Co3(bdc)4]·(DMF)2; (3), [H2NMe2]2[Co3(bpdc)4]·(CH3OH)2(DMF)1.5, where i.p., bdc, bpdc, and DMF are 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate, 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate, 4,4'-biphenyldicarboxylate, and N,N'-DMF, resp. Via different org. connectors such as i.p., bdc, and bpdc, such Co3 mol. building blocks (MBB), [Co3(CO2)8]2-, are assocd. together to give a tunable 8-connected topol. framework, viz. 42464 for 1, 36414576 for 2, and 36418536 for 3. Upon the geometry and the length of org. connectors, their corresponding porosity occupied by c counterions plus solvent mols. also can be tunable, for example, with the consideration of [H2NMe2]+ counterions, the solvent-accessible vol. is 460.2 Å3 for 1, equal to 23.9% of the cell vol., 3320.4 Å3 for 2, equal to 56.3% of the cell vol., 4107.2 Å3 for 3, equal to 50% of the cell vol. Notably, besides these outstanding features of tunable 8-connected topol. and porosity, their magnetic properties such as ferromagnetic behavior without magnetic ordering for 1, spin-canting and metamagnetic behavior with magnetic ordering for 2, as well as spin-canting, metamagnetic, and spin-glass behavior with magnetic ordering for 3 also can be tunable.

        Dybtsev, Danil N.; Chun, Hyungphil; Kim, Kimoon

        Silver(I) Coordination Polymers Based on A Nano-Sized Bent Bis(3-acetylenylphenyl-(4-cyanophenyl))oxadiazole Ligand: The Role of Ligand Isomerism and the Templating Effect of Polyatomic Anions and Solvent Intermediates
        Dong, Yu-Bin; Xu, Hong-Xia; Ma, Jian-Ping; Huang, Ru-Qi
        Inorganic Chemistry (2006), 45 (8), 3325-3343CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        One nanosized oxadiazole bridging ligand, bis(3-acetylenylphenyl-(4-cyanophenyl))oxadiazole (L11), was designed and synthesized by the reaction of bis(3-iodophenyl)oxadiazole with 4-cyanophenylacetylene via a Sonogashira-Hagihara cross-coupling reaction. Eight Ag(I)-L11 coordination polymers with 1-, two-, or three-dimensional structures were successfully prepd. by the reaction of L11 with various Ag(I) salts in soln. New coordination polymers were fully characterized by IR spectroscopy, elemental anal., and single-crystal x-ray diffraction. All new complexes contain Ag heteroatom cluster-connecting nodes, and the L11 ligand is doubling up in the frameworks. In this Ag(I)-L11 system, the conformation of L11 is versatile because of the conformational rotation around the central oxadiazole moiety and depends greatly on the counterion and solvent system used in the formation of the complexes. The luminescence property and host-guest chem. of some complexes were studied primarily.

        6c
        Design and generation of extended zeolitic metal-organic frameworks (ZMOFs): synthesis and crystal structure of zinc(II) imidazolate polymers with zeolitic frameworks.
        Tian, Yun-Qi; Zhao, Yu-Ming; Chen, Zhen-Xia; Zhang, Guang-Ning; Weng, Lin-Hong; Zhao, Dong-Yuan
        Chemistry--A European Journal (2007), 13 (15), 4146-4154CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Attempts to create metal-org. frameworks (ZMOFs) with zeolitic topologies, metal (zinc(II) and cobalt(II)) imidazolates have repeatedly been used as the metal-org. motifs of inorg. silicate analogs. By modulating the synthetic strategy based on the solvothermal and liq. diffusion method, seven further MOFs (including at least three zeolitic MOFs) of Zn(II) imidazolates, [Zn(Im)2·xG] (G = guest mol. (diethylformamide (DEF), 3-methyl-1-butanol (MB), dimethylacetamide (DMA), DMF, N-methylpyrrolidone (NMP), x = 0.2-1)) 1a-7a, were successfully synthesized. Of these, 1a-3a (G = DEF-MB, DMA-NMP, DMF, resp.) are isostructural with the previously reported Co analogs 1b-3b, resp., while 4a-7a (G = DMF, DMF-DMA-NMP, DEF< DEF, resp.) are new members of the metal imidazolate MOF family. Complex 4a exhibits a structure related to silicate CaAl2Si2O8 of CrB4 topol., but with a higher network symmetry; complex 5a has a structure with zeolitic DFT topol. that was discovered in zeolite-related materials of DAF-2, UCSB-3, and UCSB-3GaGe; complex 6a demonstrates an unprecedented zeolite-like topol. with one dimensional channels with 10-rings; and 7a displays a structure of natural zeolite GIS (gismondine) topol. All of these polymorphous MOFs were created only by using certain solvents as structure-directing agents (SDAs). Further extensive metal-org. frameworks with zeolitic topologies can be envisaged if other solvents were to be used.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        6d
        Solvent induced reactivity of 3,5-dimethylpyrazole towards zinc(II) carboxylates
        Sarma, Rupam; Kalita, Dipjyoti; Baruah, Jubaraj B.
        Dalton Transactions (2009), (36), 7428-7436CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        The reactions of 3,5-dimethylpyrazole with zinc(II) acetate dihydrate and varieties of arom. carboxylic acids led to formation of mononuclear zinc complexes [Zn(HDMP)2(RCO2)2] (R = C6H5, p-CH3-C6H4, p-NO2-C6H4 etc., HDMP = 3,5-dimethylpyrazole) in MeOH, whereas the same reactants in DMF gave binuclear 3,5-dimethylpyrazolato bridged zinc carboxylate complexes contg. monodentate 3,5-dimethylpyrazole ligands with compn. [Zn2(μ-DMP)2(HDMP)2(RCO2)2]. The mononuclear complexes can be converted to the corresponding binuclear complexes by simply dissolving in DMF. The reaction of zinc(II) acetate dihydrate with p-nitrobenzoic acid and 3,5-dimethylpyrazole in different solvents gave solvated mononuclear complexes of the corresponding solvent. All these solvated complexes having the core [Zn(HDMP)2(p-NO2-C6H4CO2)2] contain two structurally independent mols. in the asym. unit (Z' = 2).

        6e
        pH-tuned self-assembly of organic-inorganic hybrids based on different vanadate chains, Zn(II) ions and flexible ligands: crystallizing in polar and centrosymmetric space group
        Qin, Jun-Sheng; Du, Dong-Ying; Li, Shun-Li; Lan, Ya-Qian; Shao, Kui-Zhan; Su, Zhong-Min
        CrystEngComm (2011), 13 (3), 779-786CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Three org.-inorg. hybrid compds. were designed and synthesized based on different vanadate chains, Zn(II) ions and flexible ligands at different pH values under hydrothermal conditions, namely, [Zn2(bbi)2(V3O9)(OH)]·H2O (1), [Zn2(bbi)2(V4O12)] (2), and [Zn(bbi)(V2O6)] (3), where bbi is 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole). In 1, helical chains [(V3O9)3-]∞ were connected by [Zn2(OH)]3+ dimers giving rise to a 2-dimensional chiral layer which was further bridged via bbi ligands to construct a 3-dimensional POM-based chiral framework. There are two opposite helical chains [(V4O12)4-]∞ in 2. The [(V4O12)4-]∞ chains with the same chirality were connected each other by Zn2 cations to generate a 2-dimensional chiral layer, resp. The adjacent chiral layers were linked by Zn1 ions to generate a 3-dimensional noncentrosym. framework with large channel encased by bbi. Similarly, the [(V2O6)2-]∞ chains with the same chirality in 3 were connected by zinc atoms to form a 2-dimensional chiral layer which was further linked through bbi to generate a 3-dimensional centrosym. network. Compds. 2 and 3 are supramol. isomers. With adjusting the pH value of reaction mixt., the authors have achieved three new hybrids crystd. from chiral, noncentrosym. to centrosym. space group.

        (a) Cao, R.; Sun, D. F.; Liang, Y. C.; Hong, M. C.; Tatsumi, K.; Shi, Q. Inorg. Chem. 2002, 41, 2087

        7a
        Syntheses and Characterizations of Three-Dimensional Channel-like Polymeric Lanthanide Complexes Constructed by 1,2,4,5-Benzenetetracarboxylic Acid
        Cao, Rong; Sun, Daofeng; Liang, Yucang; Hong, Maochun; Tatsumi, Kazuyuki; Shi, Qian
        Inorganic Chemistry (2002), 41 (8), 2087-2094CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        The hydrothermal reaction of YbCl3·6H2O with 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic dianhydride resulted in [{Yb(bbtec)1/4(dbtec)3/6(H2O)2}4·6H2O]n (1, H4btec = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic acid), and the solvothermal reaction of Er(NO3)3·6H2O or TbCl3·6H2O with 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylic dianhydride in H2O/acetic acid gave rise to [{Er2(cbtec)2/4(ebtec)2/4(fbtec)2/4(H2O)4}·4H2O]n (2) and [{Tb(H2btec)2/4(fbtec)3/6(H2O)}·2H2O]n (3), resp. Complex 1 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group C2/m with a 20.8119(5), b 17.6174(1), c 5.7252(2) Å, β 92.324(1)°, and Z = 1. 1 Possesses a three-dimensional framework consisting of eight-coordinate ytterbium centers and two kinds of channels along the c axis. Complex 2 crystallizes in the triclinic space group P‾1 with a 9.6739(5), b 11.0039(5), c 11.5523 Å, α 104.8330(10), β 91.0000(10), γ 114.2570(10)°, and Z = 2. 2 Has a three-dimensional framework structure comprising both eight- and nine-coordinate erbium centers and channels along the a axis. Complex 3 crystallizes in the monoclinic space group P21/n with a 10.7246(12), b 7.1693(9), c 17.158(2) Å, β 97.109(2)°, and Z = 4. 3 Shows a three-dimensional framework contg. nine-coordinate terbium centers and channels along the b axis. Uncoordinated water mols. occupy the channels in the three complexes. TGA and XRPD were detd. for the three complexes, and the framework of 1 is retained upon removal of uncoordinated and coordinated water mols.

        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD38Xit1Wht7k%253D&md5=3eb730b811ff32601a9993270a10f4ef
        (b) MacDonald, J. C.; Luo, T. J. M.; Palmore, G. T. R. Cryst. Growth Des. 2004, 4, 1203
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        7b
        Supramolecular Behavior of an Isomorphous Series of Five Bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) Complexes
        MacDonald, John C.; Luo, Tzy-Jiun M.; Palmore, G. Tayhas R.
        Crystal Growth & Design (2004), 4 (6), 1203-1209CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        The supramol. chem. and crystal structures of five bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) complexes, where M = Zn, Cu, Ni, Co, and 7:3 Mn/Cu (1-5, resp.), are reported. These complexes form building blocks with nearly identical mol. structures that crystallize in the same packing pattern. Anions of 2,6-dicarboxypyridine and cations of 2-methylimidazole form N-H···O and O-H···O H bonds that dominate crystal packing by forming linear ribbons of mols. Thus, complexes 1-5 form an isomorphous series with a single robust cryst. architecture that accommodates five different transition metals without altering mol. packing. The growth of crystals from solns. that contain two different metal complexes produces mixed crystals in which mixts. of the different metal complexes are incorporated in the same relative molar ratio present in soln. This technique was used to grow crystals of 5 with Mn and Cu complexes in a 7:3 molar ratio. Complexes 1-5 form cryst. solids that represent a novel class of modular materials in which the org. ligands serve as a structural component that defines a single packing arrangement that persists over a range of structures and in which the metal serves as an interchangeable component with which to vary the phys. properties of the material. The mol. and crystal structures of bis(2-methylimidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) complexes 1-5 are reported and compared to those of a related family of bis(imidazolium 2,6-dicarboxypyridine) M(II) dihydrate complexes 1'-5' (M = Zn, Cu, Ni, Co, and Mn) reported previously. Complexes 1-5 and 1'-5' have similar packing arrangements and introducing a Me substituent (similar in size to H2O) at the C2 position of imidazole displaces H2O and prevents it from being incorporated into the lattice of 1-5.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2cXmtFamsL4%253D&md5=2d7d06ae579d3c172aab22eb655e28ac
        (c) Mahata, P.; Natarajan, S. Inorg. Chem. 2007, 46, 1250
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        7c
        A New Series of Three-Dimensional Metal-Organic Framework, [M2(H2O)][C5N1H3(COO)2]3·2H2O, M = La, Pr, and Nd: Synthesis, Structure, and Properties
        Mahata, Partha; Natarajan, Srinivasan
        Inorganic Chemistry (2007), 46 (4), 1250-1258CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Lanthanide pyridinedicarboxylates, [M2(H2O)][C5N1H3(COO)2]3·2H2O, M = La (1), Pr (2), and Nd (3), were prepd. by the reaction of trivalent lanthanide salts and 2,3-pyridinedicarboxylic acid employing a mild condition hydrothermal reaction. The structures are built up from MO8N and MO7N2 (M = lanthanide) polyhedra connected to the dicarboxylate anions forming the three-dimensional structure with 1-dimensional channels. A striking feature of this structure is the presence of an unusual Z-shaped tetramer, M4O24N6. Extra-framework water mols., located within the open channels, are reversibly adsorbed. Detailed in situ and ex situ studies using FTIR and PXRD studies clearly show that the removal of the water mols. is reversible and accompanied by changes in the size of the channel. Partial substitution at the La sites by Eu gives rise to characteristic red-pink luminescence, indicating a ligand-sensitized metal-centered emission.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXktF2nuw%253D%253D&md5=87ded554f978365cd9b385a1291357e0
        (d) Wang, Z. W.; Ji, C. C.; Li, J.; Guo, Z. J.; Li, Y. Z.; Zheng, H. G. Cryst. Growth Des. 2009, 9, 475
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        7d
        Synthesis, X-ray Structures, and Fluorescent Properties of Coordination Networks Constructed from 2-(2-Pyridinyl-benzimidazolyl) Acetic Anion
        Wang, Zuo-Wei; Ji, Chang-Chun; Li, Jing; Guo, Zi-Jian; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zheng, He-Gen
        Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (1), 475-482CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Four new metal coordination polymers, [Cd(pybma)2]n (1), [Zn(pybma)(C2O4)0.5·0.5H2O]n (2), [Co(pybma)(C2O4)0.5]n (3), and [Zn3(pybma)2(HBTC)2(H2O)4]n (4) [pybma = (2-(2-pyridinyl)benzimidazol-1-yl)acetate; H3BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate], were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized by element analyses, IR spectroscopy, and single-crystal x-ray diffraction analyses. Has a 1-dimensional (1D) chain structure, which contains two kinds of rings. Has a two-dimensional (2D) metal-org. framework and can be seen as the unity of two parallel double-stranded helixes, in which the helixes are bridged by oxalate ligands. Has a 2-dimensional framework built from 1-dimensional chains and ox bridges. Has 2-dimensional layer framework which is assembled into a three-dimensional (3D) framework with two kinds of channels. Polymers 1, 2, and 4 exhibit obvious fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp.; no fluorescent emission is obsd. in polymer 3.

        7e
        Zinc Pyromellitate Coordination Polymers with Bis(pyridylmethyl)piperazine Tethers: A Rare Binodal Network and a New Simple Self-Penetrated Topology
        Blake, Karyn M.; Lucas, Jacqueline S.; LaDuca, Robert L.
        Crystal Growth & Design (2011), 11 (4), 1287-1293CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Hydrothermal reaction of zinc nitrate, pyromellitic acid (H4pyro), and isomeric bis(pyridylmethyl)piperazines has afforded a pair of three-dimensional (3D) coordination polymers with intriguing 3D topologies. {[Zn2(Hpyro)2(H2O)2(H2-3-bpmp)]·H2O}n [1, 3-bpmp = bis(3-pyridylmethyl)piperazine] exhibits octahedral coordination at zinc and possesses a rare 4,5-connected binodal net with (4462)(4466) tcs topol. {[Zn2(Hpyro)2(H2-4-bpmp)]·4H2O}n [2, 4-bpmp = bis(4-pyridylmethyl)piperazine] has tetrahedral coordination at zinc and an unprecedented yet very simple 3,4-connected binodal (4.82)(4.82103) self-penetrated topol. Pyridyl nitrogen donor disposition and coordination geometry preference play a large role in structure-direction in this system. Complexes 1 and 2 undergo blue-violet light emission on excitation with UV light.

        Masaoka, Shigeyuki; Tanaka, Daisuke; Nakanishi, Yasunori; Kitagawa, Susumu

        Temperature-dependent supramolecular stereoisomerism in porous copper coordination networks based on a designed carboxylate ligand
        Sun, Daofeng; Ke, Yanxiong; Mattox, Tracy M.; Ooro, Betty A.; Zhou, Hong-Cai
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2005), (43), 5447-5449CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)

The polymeric complexes have PtS and NbO net topologies, resp. The polymeric complexes have similar thermal stabilities and their Langmuir surface areas and hydrogen storage capacities were detd.

        Temperature Controlled Reversible Change of the Coordination Modes of the Highly Symmetrical Multitopic Ligand To Construct Coordination Assemblies: Experimental and Theoretical Studies
        Zheng, Bo; Dong, Hao; Bai, Junfeng; Li, Yizhi; Li, Shuhua; Scheer, Manfred

        8d
        Temperature-Controlled Synthesis of Metal-Organic Coordination Polymers: Crystal Structure, Supramolecular Isomerism, and Porous Property
        Kanoo, Prakash; Gurunatha, K. L.; Maji, Tapas Kumar
        Crystal Growth & Design (2009), 9 (9), 4147-4156CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Five new supramol. metal-org. coordination polymers (MOCPs), {[Ni(bipy) (H2O)4](2,6-nds)·4H2O} (1), {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)·2H2O} (2), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (3), {[Ni (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (4), {[Cu (bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)} (5) (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridyl; 2,6-nds = 2,6-naphthalenedisulfonate) have been synthesized and structurally characterized. Compds. 1 and 5 were synthesized at room temp. in H2O/EtOH medium, whereas 2-4 were isolated under hydrothermal conditions. Compds. 1-4 were synthesized maintaining the same stoichiometric ratio of metal and ligand under different reaction temps., and the different structures of the compds. indicate that the temp. plays a significant role in the construction of the coordination polymers. Structural characterization reveals that the one-dimensional [M(bipy)(H2O)4]2+ cationic chain is a basic building unit for all of the MOCPs, while 2,6-nds remains as a counteranion. In all cases, 2,6-nds counteranions interact with water and bipy mols. through strong hydrogen-bonding and π-π interactions to afford three-dimensional supramol. structures. Compds. 1-4 have the same building unit with different network superstructures and are related as supramol. isomers. Supramol. isomerism in 3 and 4 is very interesting since they have the same mol. formula, {[Ni(bipy)(H2O)4](2,6-nds)}, and are polymorphs. Compds. 4 and 5 are isomorphous. The thermogravimetric study suggests that the dehydrated compds. are stable up to 300°. Furthermore, sorption studies suggest that dehydrated compds. of 1 and 2 are permanently porous.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXpvV2nsb4%253D&md5=e7efb7696e37adb4c0d793bff194b0f0

        9c
        Synthesis, structures and properties of Mn(II) coordination frameworks based on R-isophthalate (R = -CH3 or -C(CH3)3) and various dipyridyl-type co-ligands
        Ma, Lu-Fang; Wang, Li-Ya; Wang, Yao-Yu; Du, Miao; Wang, Jian-Ge
        CrystEngComm (2009), 11 (1), 109-117CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Five new Mn(II) metal-org. coordination polymers, [Mn(tbip)(bipy)]n (1), {[Mn(tbip)(dpe)]·1.5H2O}n (2), [Mn(tbip)(bpa)]n (3), [Mn(mip)(bpa)]n (4) and {[Mn3(mip)2(Hmip)2(bpp)2(H2O)2]·2H2O}n (5), were prepd. through hydrothermal reactions of Mn(II) acetate with H2tbip (H2tbip = 5-tert-Bu isophthalic acid) or H2mip (H2mip = 5-methylisophthalic acid) in the presence of different dipyridyl co-ligands (bipy = 4,4'-bipyridine, dpe = 1,2-bi(4-pyridyl)ethene, bpa = 1,2-bi(4-pyridyl)ethane and bpp = 1,3-di(4-pyridyl)propane). All these compds. were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectroscopy and x-ray single-crystal diffraction. The structures of 1 and 2 are constructed of [Mn2(tbip)2]n layers, which consist of alternate left- and right-handed helical chains, and further pillared by bipy or dpe ligands into a 3D porous framework. There are two different sizes of pores in 1 and 2. From the topol. point of view, both complexes 1 and 2 exhibit the rare rob network based on the dimeric [Mn(COO)]2 subunits as the 6-connected nodes. The ribbon-like chains having 8- and 16-membered rings in 3 and 4 result from dimeric Mn(II) units bridged by H2tbip or H2mip ligands, which are connected by the flexible dpa into 2D open layers. Complex 5 contains rare isophthalato-bridged trimanganese clusters as building units, which are further linked by mip anions to form a one-dimensional ladder-like chain with less common unidentate coordinated bpp decorated as pendants. The thermal stabilities and x-ray powder diffraction studies indicate that the microporous framework of 2 can keep stable even after the loss of guest water mols. In addn., dominant antiferromagnetic coupling was obsd. in compds. 1-3 and 5.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        9d
        Magnetic and luminescence properties of Cu(II), Cu(II)4O4 core, and Cd(II) mixed-ligand metal-organic frameworks constructed from 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane and benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate
        Habib, Hesham A.; Sanchiz, Joaquin; Janiak, Christoph
        Inorganica Chimica Acta (2009), 362 (7), 2452-2460CODEN: ICHAA3; ISSN:0020-1693. (Elsevier B.V.)
        The hydrothermal reaction of Cu(NO3)2·3H2O, Cu(ClO4)2·6H2O, or CdSO4·8/3H2O with benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) produced the mixed-ligand coordination polymers and networks (MOFs) 1∞{[Cu(H2btc)2(μ-btre)]} (1), 3∞{[Cu4(μ5-btc)2(μ3-OH)2(μ4-btre)]·2H2O} (2), and 3∞{[Cd3(μ6-btc)2(μ4-btre)]·H2O} (3). The centrosym. tetranuclear, chair-shaped or stepped-cubane Cu4O4 metal building unit in 2 has three different Cu contacts, each involving more than one bridging group. A quasi-butterfly magnetostructural model shows dominant antiferromagnetic interactions in this Cu4 unit with three different magnetic exchange pathways with 2J1 = 258, 2J2 = -416, and 2J3 = 484 cm-1 from the magnetic susceptibility measurement between 1.9 and 300 K. For this Cu4O4 unit the Eigenvalues assocd. with the zero field spin Hamiltonian were calcd. by solving the 16 × 16 matrix to obtain the numerical expression for the magnetic susceptibility. The Cd-btre framework 3, with bridged Cd strands, shows a strong bluish fluorescence at 421 nm upon excitation at 317 nm (not seen in the free btre ligand).

        Crystal structures and solid-state CPMAS 13C NMR correlations in luminescent zinc(II) and cadmium(II) mixed-ligand coordination polymers constructed from 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane and benzenedicarboxylate
        Habib, Hesham A.; Hoffmann, Anke; Hoeppe, Henning A.; Janiak, Christoph
        Dalton Transactions (2009), (10), 1742-1751CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)

The compds., characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, x-ray powder diffraction, solid-state cross-polarization (CP) magic-angle-spinning (MAS) 13C NMR and thermoanal., feature 3-dimensional metal-org. frameworks for 1 and 2 and 2-dimensional double layers which are connected through H bonds from the aqua ligands for 3. The CPMAS 13C NMR spectra picture the symmetry-independent (unique) C atoms and the bdc/i.p.-to-btre ligand ratio in agreement with the crystal structures. The Zn and Cd coordination polymers 1-3 show a strong bluish fluorescence upon excitation with UV light (the free btre ligand is nonluminescent).

        9f
        Mixed-ligand coordination polymers from 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane and benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylate: Trinuclear nickel or zinc secondary building units for three-dimensional networks with crystal-to-crystal transformation upon dehydration
        Habib, Hesham A.; Sanchiz, Joaquin; Janiak, Christoph
        Dalton Transactions (2008), (13), 1734-1744CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        The hydrothermal reaction of M(NO3)2·6H2O (M = Ni and Zn) with benzene-1,3,5-tricarboxylic acid (H3btc) and 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) produced the mixed-ligand coordination polymers (MOFs) 3∞{[Ni3(μ3-btc)2(μ4-btre)2(μ-H2O)2]·∼22H2O} (1) and 3∞{[Zn3(μ4-btc)2(μ4-btre)(H2O)2]·2H2O} (3). The compds., characterized by single-crystal x-ray diffraction, x-ray powder diffraction and thermoanal. feature trinuclear secondary building units (SBU) within the three-dimensional frameworks. The trinuclear Ni unit in 1 exhibits an intra-trimer together with some weak inter-trimer antiferromagnetic coupling with J = -13.88(8) cm-1 from the magnetic susceptibility measurement between 1.9-300 K. The Zn coordination polymer 3 shows a strong fluorescence at 423 nm upon excitation at 323 nm (not seen in the free btre ligand). 3 Is thermally robust until 200° (ambient pressure) where loss of the H2O mols. starts. Careful control of the dehydration procedure (freeze-drying) for 1 and (heating to 280°) for 3 allowed for a solid-state reaction with single-crystal-to-single-crystal structural transformations in obtaining the largely dehydrated products 3∞{[Ni3(μ2-btc)2(μ4-btre)2(μ-H2O)2(H2O)2]·4H2O} (2) and 3∞{[Zn3(μ6-btc)2(μ4-btre)2]·∼0.67H2O} (4), resp. In the transformation from 1 to 2 the unit cell vol. is reduced to ∼60%. The transition from 3 to 4 involves breakage and formation of new Zn-O bonds.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        (g) Zhang, L. P.; Yang, J.; Ma, J. F.; Jia, Z. F.; Xie, Y. P.; Wei, G. H. CrystEngComm 2008, 10, 1410

        9g
        A series of 2D and 3D metal-organic frameworks based on different polycarboxylate anions and a flexible 2,2'-bis(1H-imidazolyl)ether ligand
        Zhang, Lai-Ping; Yang, Jin; Ma, Jian-Fang; Jia, Zhi-Fang; Xie, Yun-Peng; Wei, Guo-Hua
        CrystEngComm (2008), 10 (10), 1410-1420CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Eight new coordination polymers, namely [Ni(L1)(BIE)] (1), [Cu(L1)(BIE)] (2), [Cu(L2)(BIE)] (3), [Co(L3)(BIE)] (4), [Cu(L4)0.5(BIE)] (5), [Co2(L4)(BIE)2]·H2O (6), [Cu5(L5)4(μ3-O)2(BIE)2(H2O)2] (7) and [Cu3(L6)2(BIE)2(H2O)3] (8), where L1 = p-phthalate, L2 = o-phthalate, L3 = oxalate, L4 = 1,2,4,5-benzenetetracarboxylate, L5 = m-phthalate, L6 = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate and BIE = 2,2'-bis(1H-imidazolyl)ether, were successfully synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Polymers 1-4 display 2D layer structures. 1, 2 And 3 hold the similar 4-connected 44-sql nets, while 4 exhibits a 3-connected 63-hcb net. 5 Possesses an unusual 4-connected Kagome net with two kinds of connected nodes. 6 Shows a rare 3,4-connected (83)2(85·10) topol. with 3-connected nodes and square-planar 4-connected nodes. 7 Exhibits an α-Po topol. based on pentanuclear Cu(II) cluster. 8 Is a unique self-penetrating 2D network with 3,4-connected (6.72)(6.7.8)(62·7.82·9) topol. The structural differences of 1-8 suggest the importance of polycarboxylate ligands and central metals in the network construction of the coordination polymers.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        (h) Wisser, B.; Lu, Y.; Janiak, C. Z. Anorg. Allg. Chem. 2007, 633, 1189

        9h
        Chiral coordination polymers with amino acids: 2∞[Cu2(μ-L-tryptophanato)2(μ-4,4'-bipyridine)(H2O)2](NO2)2
        Wisser, Barbara; Lu, Yirong; Janiak, Christoph
        Zeitschrift fuer Anorganische und Allgemeine Chemie (2007), 633 (8), 1189-1192CODEN: ZAACAB; ISSN:0044-2313. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        The two-dimensional mixed-ligand network catena[(μ-4,4'-bipyridine)-bis(μ-L-tryptophanato-κ3N,O,O')-diaqua-di-copper(II)dinitrate] is constructed through the bridging action of both the tridentate amino carboxylato and the bidentate 4,4'-bipyridine ligand. The enantiomeric L-tryptophanato ligand acts as an N,O chelate towards one copper atom and bridges through the second carboxylate oxygen atom to the adjacent copper ion. Stacking of the corrugated nets creates channels which are occupied by the hydrogen-bonded and very weakly Cu-coordinating nitrate ions.

        Stabilization of the 2D inclined interpenetrated net of [Co(bpe)(tp)(H2O)2]n by replacement of lattice water molecules with appropriate solvent
        Manna, Subal Chandra; Okamoto, Ken-ichi; Zangrando, Ennio; Chaudhuri, Nirmalendu Ray
        CrystEngComm (2007), 9 (3), 199-202CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A 1-pot reaction of three different components [Co(II), terephthalate dianion (tp) and 1,2-bis(4-pyridyl)ethane (bpe)] in water-MeOH (1:1) solvent leads to the self assembly of a 2-dimensional inclined interpenetrated network {[Co(bpe)(tp)(H2O)2]·2.5(H2O)}n (1), stabilized as {[Co(bpe)(tp)(H2O)2]·(glycol)}n (2) when the reaction is carried out in (1:1) H2O-glycol medium.

        The generation of a chiral network Ni2(R*COO)4(H2O)(4,4'-bipy)2 (R*COO- = dehydroabietate), was achieved through the deliberate use of enantiomerically pure carboxylic acid, dehydroabietic acid, under hydrothermal conditions.

        9l
        Crystal engineering of 3-D coordination polymers by pillaring ferromagnetic copper(II)-methylmalonate layers
        Pasan, Jorge; Sanchiz, Joaquin; Lloret, Francesc; Julve, Miguel; Ruiz-Perez, Catalina
        CrystEngComm (2007), 9 (6), 478-487CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Three new Cu(II) complexes [Cu(Memal)(H2O)]n (1), [Cu2(pyz)(Memal)2] (2) and [Cu2(4,4'-bpy)(Memal)2(H2O)2] (3) (Memal = methylmalonate, pyz = pyrazine and 4,4'-bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine) were obtained and structurally characterized by x-ray diffraction. Complex 1 is a square grid of aquacopper(II) units which are linked by carboxylate-methylmalonate groups in the anti-syn (equatorial-equatorial) coordination mode. The crystal structures of 2 and 3 consist of corrugated layers of Cu(II) (2) and aquacopper(II) (3) units with intralayer carboxylate-methylmalonate bridges in the anti-syn (equatorial-apical) coordination mode which are linked through pyrazine (2) and 4,4'-bipyridine (3) ligands, to build up a 3-dimensional network. Magnetic susceptibility measurements of complexes 1-3 in the temp. range 2-300 K show the occurrence of an overall ferromagnetic behavior with a weak intralayer ferromagnetic coupling (J = +1.61(1) cm-1) in 1 whereas two opposite magnetic interactions occur in 2 and 3, one ferromagnetic through the anti-syn carboxylate (2 and 3) and the other antiferromagnetic through pyz (2) and 4,4'-bpy (3).
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD2sXntlGgtrg%253D&md5=187864055553fdc25917de1592eb3013
        (m) Stephenson, M. D.; Hardie, M. J. Dalton Trans. 2006, 3407
        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        9m
        Coordination and hydrogen bonded network structures of Cu(II) with mixed ligands: a hybrid hydrogen bonded material, an infinite sandwich arrangement, and a 3-D net
        Stephenson, Maria D.; Hardie, Michaele J.
        Dalton Transactions (2006), (28), 3407-3417CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Mixed-ligand Cu(II) complexes with deprotonated trimesic acid and phenanthroline-type ligands were synthesized by solvothermal methods to form 2-dimensional infinite hexagonal H bonded structures with addnl. trimesic acid (H3tma) mols. [Cu(phendione)2(H2tma)2]·2(H3tma)·1.65(CF3CH2OH)·2.5(H2O), where phendione = 1,10-phenanthroline-5,6-dione, has H bonded networks of [Cu(phendione)2(H2tma)2] complexes interspersed with layers of H3tma with a topol. identical H bonding network. Whereas in [Cu(1,10-phenanthroline)(H2tma)2]2·2(H3tma), a dimeric Cu(II) complex H bonds directly to addnl. H3tma mols. to form a three-layered 2-dimensional network resembling an infinite sandwich. The synthesis and structures of simple Cu(II) complexes of the phendione ligand are also reported. One of these, [Cu(phendione)2Br2] shows a particularly polar packing arrangement.

        9n
        Hydrothermal synthesis, crystal structures and effect of nonbonding interactions in crystal packing of two mixed-ligand metal complexes with glycolato and 2,2'-dipiridylamine and with benzilato and imidazole
        Carballo, Rosa; Covelo, Berta; Vazquez-Lopez, Ezequiel M.; Garcia-Martinez, Emilia; Castineiras, Alfonso; Janiak, Christoph
        Zeitschrift fuer Anorganische und Allgemeine Chemie (2005), 631 (11), 2006-2010CODEN: ZAACAB; ISSN:0044-2313. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Two new mixed-ligand complexes [Fe(HG)2(dipyam)] (1) (HG = glycolato and dipyam = 2,2'-dipyridylamine) and [Cu(HB)2(Im)2]·2H2O (2) (HB = benzilato and Im = imidazole) were hydrothermally synthesized and structurally characterized by x-ray diffraction. In both cases the metallic center is in an octahedral environment, strongly distorted in 2 (4+2 coordination). The α-hydroxycarboxylato ligands (glycolato or benzilato) present different coordinative behavior, bidentate chelate through the hydroxyl O and one carboxy O in 1 and through the two O atoms of the carboxylate group in 2. The complexes are extended into 2-dimensional frameworks through H bonding and π···π or C-H···π interactions. The complexes were also characterized by elemental anal., FTIR and UV-visible spectroscopy and room temp. magnetic measurements.

        Three-dimensional metal-organic frameworks constructed from bix and 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylate
        Yao, Jing; Lu, Zhen-Da; Li, Yi-Zhi; Lin, Jian-Guo; Duan, Xian-Ying; Gao, Song; Meng, Qing-Jin; Lu, Chang-Sheng
        CrystEngComm (2008), 10 (10), 1379-1383CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Two new metal-org. complexes [Cd1.5(btrc)(bix)]n (1) and [Zn2(btrc)(Hbtrc)0.5(bix)2]n (2) (btrc = 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylate; bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene) were hydrothermally synthesized and characterized by single crystal x-ray diffraction. Complex 1 represents a three-dimensional (3D) structure based on the 2D sheets and bix pillars. Complex 2 exhibits unique architecture. The two complexes exhibit strong fluorescent emissions in their solid states at room temp.

        9p
        Syntheses, structures and luminescent properties of zinc(II) and cadmium(II) coordination complexes based on new bis(imidazolyl)ether and different carboxylate ligands
        Wei, Guo-Hua; Yang, Jin; Ma, Jian-Fang; Liu, Ying-Ying; Li, Shun-Li; Zhang, Lai-Ping
        Dalton Transactions (2008), (23), 3080-3092CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Mixed-ligand coordination complexes, [Zn(CA)2(BIE)] (1), [Zn(OX)(BIE)]·H2O (2), [Zn2(m-BDC)2(BIE)2] (3), [Cd(m-BDC)(BIE)] (4), [Cd(5-OH-m-BDC)(BIE)] (5), [Zn(5-OH-m-BDC)(BIE)] (6), [Zn2(p-BDC)2(BIE)2]·2.5H2O (7), [Cd3(p-BDC)3(BIE)] (8), [Cd3(BTC)2(BIE)2]·0.5H2O (9) and [Zn(BTCA)0.5(BIE)] (10), where CA = cinnamate anion, OX = oxalate anion, m-BDC = 1,3-benzenedicarboxylate anion, 5-OH-m-BDC = 5-OH-1,3-benzenedicarboxylate anion, p-BDC = 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate anion, BTC = 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylate anion, BTCA = 1,2,3,4-butanetetracarboxylate anion, and BIE = 2,2'-bis(1H-imidazolyl)ether, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by x-ray crystallog. In 1, a pair of BIE ligands bridge adjacent Zn(II) atoms to give a centrosym. dimer. In 2 and 3, BIE ligands connect Zn(II)-carboxylate chains to form hexagonal honeycomb 63-hcb and square 44-sql layers, resp. In 4 and 5, m-BDC and 5-OH-m-BDC bridge Cd(II) atoms to give dimeric units, resp., which are further linked by BIE ligands to form sql nets. In 6, the BIE ligands extend the Zn(II)-carboxylate chains into 2-dimensional sinusoidal-like sql nets. The undulated sql nets polycatenate each other in the parallel manner with DOC (degree of catenation) = 2, yielding a rare 2-dimensional → 3-dimensional parallel polycatenation net. In 7, the BIE and p-BDC ligands link the Zn(II) atoms to give a rare 3-fold interpenetrated 3-connected 103-ths net. 8 Contains unusual edge-sharing polyhedral rods formed by [Cd3(CO2)6] clusters. Each rod is connected by the benzene rings of p-BDC in four directions into a simple α-Po topol. In 9, two kinds of different 2-dimensional Cd-BTC layers are alternately linked to each other by sharing Cd(II) centers to form a 3-dimensional framework, which is further linked by two kinds of BIE ligand to produce a complicated 3-dimensional polymeric structure. 10 Possesses a unique (3,4)-connected 3-dimensional framework with (83)2(85·10) topol. The structural differences described indicate the importance of carboxylate ligands and metals in the framework formation of coordination complexes. The IR spectra, thermogravimetric and luminescent properties were also studied in detail for the compds.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXms1yht70%253D&md5=6b9c800e980e6688608c8a3048997a35

        [Crossref], [PubMed], [CAS], Google Scholar
        9q
        A manganese(II) coordination polymer with mixed pyrimidine-2-carboxylate and oxalate bridges: synthesis, structure, and magnetism
        Zhang, Jian-Yong; Ma, Yu; Cheng, Ai-Ling; Yue, Qi; Sun, Qian; Gao, En-Qing
        Dalton Transactions (2008), (15), 2061-2066CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A new two-dimensional (2D) coordination polymer with mixed pyrimidine-2-carboxylate (pymca) and oxalate (ox) bridges, [Mn2(pymca)2(ox)(H2O)2]n (1), was synthesized by a hydrothermal reaction involving the in-situ formation of the pymca and ox ligands from 2-cyanopyrimidine (pymCN), and its structure and magnetic properties were characterized. The dianionic ox and monoanionic pymca ligands are both potentially bis(chelating) and have been used to construct anionic and cationic 2D honeycomb networks [(6,3) net], resp. In 1 ox assumes the usual bis(chelating) bridging mode but pymca serves as a tridentate bridge with one of the pyrimidyl nitrogens uncoordinated. The two different bridges collaborate to generate a highly undulated 2D layer with the (6,3) net topol. and the layers are closely packed in parallel through π-π interactions between pyrimidyl rings and hydrogen bonds involving coordinated water mols., oxalate oxygens, and uncoordinated pyrimidyl nitrogens. Magnetic measurements reveal that the compd. is a spin-canted antiferromagnet with weak ferromagnetic transition below Tc = 2.4 K.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXkt1Sqtbo%253D&md5=89c84c49f52fc1830db1937b10f0204f

        10a
        Crystal Structure Solid-State Cross Polarization Magic Angle Spinning 13C NMR Correlation in Luminescent d10 Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed with the 1,2-Bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane Ligand
        Habib, Hesham A.; Hoffmann, Anke; Hoppe, Henning A.; Steinfeld, Gunther; Janiak, Christoph
        Inorganic Chemistry (2009), 48 (5), 2166-2180CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Hydrothermal reactions of 1,2-bis(1,2,4-triazol-4-yl)ethane (btre) with copper(II), zinc(II), and cadmium(II) salts have yielded the dinuclear complexes [Zn2Cl4(μ2-btre)2] (1) and [Zn2Br4(μ2-btre)2] (2), the one-dimensional coordination polymer ∞1[Zn(NCS)2(μ2-btre)] (3), the two-dimensional networks ∞2[Cu2(μ2-Cl)2(μ4-btre)] (4), ∞2[Cu2(μ2-Br)2(μ4-btre)] (5), and ∞2{[Cd6(μ3-OH)2(μ3-SO4)4(μ4-btre)3(H2O)6](SO4)·∼6H2O} (6), and the three-dimensional frameworks ∞3{[Cu(μ4-btre)]ClO4·∼0.25H2O} (7), ∞3{[Zn(μ4-btre)(μ2-btre)](ClO4)2} (8), ∞3{[Cd(μ4-btre)(μ2-btre)](ClO4)2} (9), and ∞3[Cu2(μ2-CN)2(μ4-btre)] (10, 2-fold 3D interpenetrated framework). The copper-contg. products 4, 5, 7, and 10 contain the metal in the +1 oxidn. state, from a simultaneous redox and self-assembly reaction of the Cu(II) starting materials. The cyanide-contg. framework 10 has captured the CN- ions from the oxidative btre decompn. The perchlorate frameworks 7, 8, or 9 react in an aq. NH4+PF6- soln. with formation of the related PF6--contg. frameworks. The differences in the metal-btre bridging mode (μ2-κN1:N1', μ2-κN1:N2 or μ4-κN1:N2:N1':N2') and the btre ligand symmetry can be correlated with different signal patterns in the 13C cross polarization magic angle spinning (CPMAS) NMR spectra. Compds. 2, 4, 5 and 7 to 10 exhibit fluorescence at 403-481 nm upon excitation at 270-373 nm which is not seen in the free btre ligand.
        >> More from SciFinder ®

        (b) Lan, Y. Q.; Li, S. L.; Fu, Y. M.; Xu, Y. H.; Li, L.; Su, Z. M.; Fu, Q. Dalton Trans. 2008, 6796

        10b
        d10-Metal coordination polymers based on analogue di(pyridyl)imidazole derivatives and 4,4'-oxydibenzoic acid: influence of flexible and angular characters of neutral ligands on structural diversity
        Lan, Ya-Qian; Li, Shun-Li; Fu, Yao-Mei; Xu, Yan-Hong; Li, Lu; Su, Zhong-Min; Fu, Qiang
        Dalton Transactions (2008), (47), 6796-6807CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Mixed-ligand coordination complexes, [Zn(L1)(oba)] (1), [Cd(L1)(oba)] (2), [Zn2(L2)(oba)2]·8H2O (3), [Cd2(L2)(oba)2]·2H2O (4), [Zn3(L3)(oba)3] (5), [Cd2(L3)(oba)2]·(L3) (6), [Cd(L4)(oba)]·H2O (7) and [Cd(L5)(oba)]·3H2O (8), where L1 = 2-(2-pyridyl)imidazole, L2 = 1,4-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-yl]butane, L3 = 1,4-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene, L4 = 1,3-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene, L5 = 1,2-bis[2-(2-pyridyl)imidazol-1-ylmethyl]benzene and H2oba = 4,4'-oxydibenzoic acid, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Their structures were detd. by single crystal x-ray diffraction analyses and further characterized by elemental analyses, IR spectra, and thermogravimetric (TG) analyses. In 1 and 2, oba2-, L1 ligand and ZnII or CdII ions form parallel chains or parallel sheets which are linked by the weak H bonding and π···π stacking interactions to give the 2-dimensional supramol. sheet or 3-dimensional supramol. net, resp. For 3, L2 ligands connect [Zn(oba)] chains to generate a (10,3)-b topol. structure, the 1st example of 8-fold interpenetrating framework based on the (10,3)-b net. In 4, L2 ligands link [Cd(oba)] double-chains to give a 2-dimensional sheet which is assembled by π···π stacking interactions to obtain a 3-dimensional supramol. net. In 5, L3 ligands link ZnII ions from α-Po net formed by ZnII ions and oba2- anions to show a novel 3-dimensional 8-connected self-penetrating framework with the unreported (416·611·8) topol. structure. In 6, the double-chains constructed by CdII and oba2- anions are linked by one kind of L3 ligand to form a layer-like structure which is assembled by π···π stacking interactions to show a 3-dimensional supramol. structure. In 7, oba2- anions coordinate to CdII cations to form chains which are connected by L4 to form a 4-fold interpenetrating diamond network. In 8, the weak H bonding and π···π stacking interactions connect the [Cd(L5)(oba)] chains to give a 2-dimensional supramol. sheet. From the structures of 1-8, the different flexible and angular neutral ligands, coordination geometries of metal centers and weak interactions (H bonds and π···π stacking interactions) are crucial factors for the formation of the different structures. The photoluminescent properties of 1-8 were studied in the solid state at room temp.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhsVajtbjI&md5=128df781c8bfc965ddaedd32b0f3e17f

        10c
        1D, 2D and 3D luminescent zinc(II) coordination polymers assembled from varying flexible thioether ligands
        Ren, Peng; Liu, Ming-Li; Zhang, Jun; Shi, Wei; Cheng, Peng; Liao, Dai-Zheng; Yan, Shi-Ping
        Dalton Transactions (2008), (35), 4711-4713CODEN: DTARAF; ISSN:1477-9226. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        Using a series flexible thioether ligands, 4-(2-pyridylmethylthio)benzoic acid (HL1), 4-(4-pyridylmethylthio)benzoic acid (HL2) and 4-(3-pyridylmethylthio)benzoic acid (HL3), a 1-dimensional infinite chain [Zn3(L1)6]n (1), a 2-dimensional interpenetrating sheet [Zn(L2)2]n (2), and a chiral 3-dimensional framework [Zn(L3)2H2O]n (3) were obtained. Luminescent properties of these compds. were also studied.
