      11. 11
        (a) Ryan, P. E.; Lescop, C.; Laliberté, D.; Hamilton, T.; Maris, T.; Wuest, J. D. Inorg. Chem. 2009, 48, 2793
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        11a
        Engineering New Metal-Organic Frameworks Built from Flexible Tetrapyridines Coordinated to Cu(II) and Cu(I)
        Ryan, Patrick E.; Lescop, Christophe; Laliberte, Dominic; Hamilton, Tamara; Maris, Thierry; Wuest, James D.
        Inorganic Chemistry (2009), 48 (7), 2793-2807CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        New metal-org. frameworks were constructed by the coordination of Cu(II) and Cu(I) with pentaerythrityl tetrakis(4-pyridyl) ether (1 = PETPE), a flexible tetradentate ligand. Networks derived from Cu(OOCCH3)2, Cu(NO3)2, and CuBF4 proved to have different topologies (diamondoid, PtS, and SrAl2, resp.). This reflects (1) the ability of PETPE (1) to adopt diverse conformations and (2) the varied geometries of complexes of Cu(II) and Cu(I). Extended PETPE (I; R = H (2)), a tetrapyridine with Ph spacers inserted into the pentaerythrityl core of PETPE (1), yielded an expanded version of the PtS network derived from simple PETPE (1) and Cu(NO3)2. However, increases in the ability of the network to accommodate guests were largely offset by interpenetration of independent networks. Attempts to thwart interpenetration by converting ligand 2 into Me-substituted deriv. (I; R = Me (3)) led to the construction of networks with alternative topologies. In particular, the reactions of ligand 3 with both Cu(II) and Cu(I) yielded isostructural Pt3O4 networks, despite the preference of the two oxidn. states for coordination spheres with different geometries. Together, these observations demonstrate that PETPE (1) and related compds. are useful ligands for constructing metal-org. frameworks, with a distinctive ability to accommodate a single metal in different oxidn. states, as well as to adapt to a metal in a single oxidn. state but with different counterions or secondary ligands.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1MXivVeit7o%253D&md5=78be00af9a9fbef7ca1b27dd0a0a193b
        (b) Zhang, Q. C.; Bu, X. H.; Lin, Z. E.; Wu, T.; Feng, P. Y. Inorg. Chem. 2008, 47, 9724
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        11b
        Organization of Tetrahedral Chalcogenide Clusters Using a Tetrahedral Quadridentate Linker
        Zhang, Qichun; Bu, Xianhui; Lin, Zhien; Wu, Tao; Feng, Pingyun
        Inorganic Chemistry (Washington, DC, United States) (2008), 47 (21), 9724-9726CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Using predesigned tetrahedral quadridentate linker tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane (TPOM) as the org. linker, tetrahedral P1 clusters ([Cd8S(SPh)16]2-) and C1 clusters ([Cd17S4(SPh)28]2-) were assembled into beltlike {[Cd8S(SPh)14](TPOM)}n (MCOF-9) or chainlike {[Cd17S4(SPh)26](TPOM)}n (MCOF-10) configurations, as detd. by single-crystal x-ray diffraction. The onset of optical absorptions of MCOF-9 and MCOF-10 is ∼400 and 420 nm, resp. The thermal anal. shows that both materials are stable up to 250°.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXhtF2isr7M&md5=36173f691ca4aba7bd14330e763e8ebe
        (c) Hu, J. S.; Shang, Y. J.; Yao, X. Q.; Qin, L.; Li, Y. Z.; Guo, Z. J.; Zheng, H. G.; Xue, Z. L. Cryst. Growth Des. 2010, 10, 2676
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        11c
        Syntheses, Structures, and Photoluminescence of Five New Metal-Organic Frameworks Based on Flexible Tetrapyridines and Aromatic Polycarboxylate Acids
        Hu, Jin-Song; Shang, Yong-Jia; Yao, Xiao-qiang; Qin, Ling; Li, Yi-Zhi; Guo, Zi-Jian; Zheng, He-Gen; Xue, Zi-Ling
        Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (6), 2676-2684CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Solvothermal reactions of tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane (TPOM) with deprotonated 1,4-benzenedicarboxylate (H2bdc) or 5-hydroxyisophthalic acid (5-OH-H2bdc) in the presence of nitrates of cadmium, zinc, and cobalt in H2O or H2O/DMF produced five new complexes, namely, {[Cd2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)5(DMF)}n (1), {[Zn2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)4}n (2), {[Zn2(TPOM)(bdc)2]·(H2O)}n (3), {[Co2(TPOM)(5-OH-bdc)2(H2O)2]·(H2O)5}n (4), and {[Cd2(TPOM)(5-OH-bdc)2]·(H2O)2}n (5). These complexes were characterized by elemental anal., IR spectroscopy, and x-ray single-crystal diffraction. Complex 1 reveals a 2-fold interpenetrating three-dimensional (3D) framework with pcu topol. constructed from binuclear Cd clusters and TPOM ligands. In addn., the expt. of single-crystal-to-single-crystal (SC-SC) structural transformations upon guest exchange was tested. Zn complexes 2 and 3 possess different 3D frameworks and are prepd. from TPOM and H2bdc under different reaction conditions. In complexes 4 and 5, TPOM and 5-OH-H2bdc link Co or Cd centers to generate 3D interpenetrating frameworks with bbf and qtz topol. In addn., thermal stabilities and photochem. properties of these new complexes in the solid state have been studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXltlygtrk%253D&md5=c74da9c559e8b27a2df20dd1b9af2039
        (d) Ren, S. B.; Zhou, L.; Zhang, J.; Li, Y. Z.; Du, H. B.; You, X. Z. CrystEngComm 2009, 11, 1834

        11d
        A photoluminescent interpenetrating diamondoid metal-organic framework based on Cu4I4 clusters with high thermal stability
        Ren, Shi-Bin; Zhou, Le; Zhang, Jun; Li, Yi-Zhi; Du, Hong-Bin; You, Xiao-Zeng
        CrystEngComm (2009), 11 (9), 1834-1836CODEN: CRECF4; ISSN:1466-8033. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        A new, triply-interpenetrating diamondoid metal-org. framework, which exhibits strong photoluminescence at room temp. and high thermal stability, was prepd. by the self-assembly of tetrahedral quadridentate linker tetrakis(4-pyridyloxymethylene)methane and tetrahedral Cu4I4 clusters under solvothermal conditions.

        12
        Highly interpenetrated supramolecular networks supported by N···I halogen bonding
        Metrangolo, Pierangelo; Meyer, Franck; Pilati, Tullio; Proserpio, Davide M.; Resnati, Giuseppe
        Chemistry--A European Journal (2007), 13 (20), 5765-5772CODEN: CEUJED; ISSN:0947-6539. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Halogen bonding (XB) has been used to assemble tetrakis(4-pyridyl)pentaerythritol (tetradentate XB acceptor) with different α,ω-diiodoperfluoroalkanes (bidentate XB donors) or tetrakis(4-iodotetrafluorophenyl)-pentaerythritol (tetradentate XB donor). The remarkable linearity of the XB formed, the rodlike character of α,ω-diiodoperfluoroalkanes and the mutual complementarities of pentaerythritol partners, translate the three-dimensional character of the XB accept- or into open primary networks, which interpenetrate to avoid the presence of voids and to ensure segregation of the modules. Two-dimensional (2D) square 44 layers (sql) with fourfold and fivefold interpenetration, as well as an eightfold diamondoid network (dia) of class la and a remarkable tenfold dia network of class IIIa, have been obtained.

        (a) Wen, L.; Lu, Z.; Lin, J.; Tian, Z.; Zhu, H.; Meng, Q. Cryst. Growth Des. 2007, 7, 93

        15a
        Syntheses, Structures, and Physical Properties of Three Novel Metal-Organic Frameworks Constructed from Aromatic Polycarboxylate Acids and Flexible Imidazole-Based Synthons
        Wen, Lili; Lu, Zhenda; Lin, Jianguo; Tian, Zhengfang; Zhu, Huizhen; Meng, Qingjin
        Crystal Growth & Design (2007), 7 (1), 93-99CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Three novel interesting coordination polymers, [Cd3(SIP)2(bbi)5·3H2O]n (1), [Co3(SIP)2(bix)4(2H2O)·2H2O]n (2), and [Cd(2,5-pydc)2(bix)1.5·H2O]n (3) (SIP = 5-sulfoisophthalic acid monosodium salt; bbi = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole); bix = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)-benzene; 2,5-pydc = pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid), were isolated under hydrothermal conditions and structurally characterized. Polymer 1 has a 3-dimensional complicated framework comprised of an infinite 1-dimensional ladder-like chain and 2-dimensional layer structure. Polymer 2 features a 3-dimensional hydrated framework with uncoordinated H2O mols. trapped in the pores. Polymer 3 is a 2-dimensional infinite layer framework, which is further interconnected by H-bond interactions to lead to a 3-dimensional supramol. architecture. Compds. 1 and 3 exhibit medium-strong fluorescent emissions in the solid state at room temp. and could be significant in the field of photoactive materials.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD28Xht12itb7K&md5=afbe6b00336b9500cbb1b559d7532caa

        15b
        Series of 2D and 3D Coordination Polymers Based on 1,2,3,4-Benzenetetracarboxylate and N-Donor Ligands: Synthesis, Topological Structures, and Photoluminescent Properties
        Zhang, Lai-Ping; Ma, Jian-Fang; Yang, Jin; Pang, Yuan-Yuan; Ma, Ji-Cheng
        Inorganic Chemistry (2010), 49 (4), 1535-1550CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        Nine new coordination polymers, namely, [Mn2(L)(H2O)4]·H2O (1), [Cd(L)0.5(H2O)] (2), [Zn5(L)2(μ3-O)2(H2O)4]·2H2O (3), [Zn4(L)2(μ3-O)2][Zn(H2O)6]·2H2O (4), [Zn2(L)(biim-4)0.5(H2O)3]·H2O (5), [Cd2(L)(bpy)(H2O)]·2H2O·0.5(CH3CH2OH) (6), [Cu2(H2L)2(bpy)2] (7), [Cu2(L)(bpy)(H2O)] (8), and [Cu2(L)(bpy)1.5(H2O)2.5] (9), where H4L = 1,2,3,4-benzenetetracarboxylic acid, biim-4 = 1,1'-(1,4-butanediyl)bis(imidazole), and bpy = 4,4'-bipyridine, were synthesized under hydrothermal conditions. Compd. 1 displays a rare trinodal (3,4,7)-connected (42·6)(45·6)(47·68·86) topol. 2 Possesses an α-Po net. 3 Is a novel 3-dimensional framework based on pentanuclear ZnII clusters. By adjustment of the pH values of the reaction mixt. of 3 with a Na2CO3 soln., a structurally different compd., 4, was obtained, which exhibits a 3-dimensional porous framework with the [Zn(H2O)6]2+ cations located in the channels. 5 Is an unusual example of a trinodal (3,5)-connected network with a Schlafli symbol of (42·6)(62·8)(42·62·85·10), whereas 6, contg. tetranuclear CdII clusters, shows a rare (4,6)-connected (44·62)2(44·610·8) topol. 7 Exhibits a unique polythreading network, while 8 displays a scarce trinodal (3,4,5)-connected self-penetrating network. In comparison with 8, the chiral compd. 9 possesses an unprecedented tetranodal (2,4)-connected (7)(75·11)(62·73·8)2(6·74 × 10)2 topol. The effects of the carboxylate ligands, the pH values, the reaction temps., the central metals, and the neutral ligands were elucidated. The IR spectra, TGA, and luminescent properties for the compds. were also studied.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXptlylsA%253D%253D&md5=d2c4a48059e1d759c93ead82c8efa09c
      16. 16
        Lloret, F.; Julve, M.; Cano, J.; Ruiz-García, R.; Pardo, E. Inorg. Chim. Acta 2008, 361, 3432
        [Crossref], [CAS], Google Scholar
        16
        Magnetic properties of six-coordinated high-spin cobalt(II) complexes: Theoretical background and its application
        Lloret, Francesc; Julve, Miguel; Cano, Joan; Ruiz-Garcia, Rafael; Pardo, Emilio
        Inorganica Chimica Acta (2008), 361 (12-13), 3432-3445CODEN: ICHAA3; ISSN:0020-1693. (Elsevier B.V.)
        In this contribution the authors study and analyze the influence of the different parameters involved in the magnetic susceptibility of six-coordinated high-spin Co(II) complexes. The authors propose an empirical expression to fit the magnetic susceptibility of polycryst. samples of mononuclear Co(II) complexes with an axial distortion, the variable parameters being Δ (axial distortion), α (orbital redn. factor) and λ (spin-orbit coupling). This expression avoids solving the 12 × 12 matrix assocd. to the distortion of the 4T1g term. To take into account the magnetic coupling (J) in the polynuclear Co(II) complexes, a perturbational approach is proposed to describe their magnetic susceptibility in the whole temp. range (2-300 K) as a function of J, Δ, α and λ. This approach is valid in the limit of the weak magnetic coupling as compared to the spin-orbit coupling, |J/λ| < 0.1. The model allows the treatment of each cobalt(II) ion in axial symmetry as an effective spin S eff = 1/2. That causes a drastic redn. of the matrix size of the polynuclear compds. from 12n × 12n to 2n × 2n, n being the no. of Co(II) ions in the complex. The main advantage of the model is to make possible the fit of the magnetic susceptibility data of those polynuclear Co(II) complexes whose high nuclearity involved intractable matrixes.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BD1cXpvVylsrg%253D&md5=28fd9a06b3d9d8d8ff80ddebf6f9ee1e

        17a
        Ferroelectric Copper Quinine Complexes
        Zhao, Hong; Qu, Zhi-Rong; Ye, Qiong; Abrahams, Brendan F.; Wang, Yi-Ping; Liu, Zhi-Guo; Xue, Ziling; Xiong, Ren-Gen; You, Xiao-Zeng
        Chemistry of Materials (2003), 15 (22), 4166-4168CODEN: CMATEX; ISSN:0897-4756. (American Chemical Society)
        The synthesis, solid-state structures, thermal stabilities, and ferroelec. properties of Cu5Cl9(H2Quinine)2 (I), and Cu3Br7(H2Quinine)2(H2O) (II) are reported. I was obtained by the reaction of CuCl, quinine, and HCl in methanol under solvothermal conditions at 60 -70°C. II was obtained under similar conditions using CuBr and HBr. These reactions are represented described. Thermogravimetric anal. (TGA) of these polycryst. complexes indicated no wt. loss below ca. 200 and 240 °C for I and II, resp. EPR spectra of the complexes are all silent, confirming that the oxidn. state of Cu ions in these solid complexes is +1. The crystal structure of I showed an anionic one-dimensional polymer of compn. of [Cu5Cl94-]n.

        17b
        A Mixed-Valence Coordination Polymer Featuring Two-Dimensional Ferroelectric Order: {[CuI4CuII(Et2dtc)2Cl3][CuII(Et2dtc)2]2(FeCl4)}n (Et2dtc- = diethyldithiocarbamate)
        Okubo, Takashi; Kawajiri, Ryo; Mitani, Tadaoki; Shimoda, Tatsuya
        Journal of the American Chemical Society (2005), 127 (50), 17598-17599CODEN: JACSAT; ISSN:0002-7863. (American Chemical Society)
        The 1st mixed-valence coordination polymer indicating ferroelec. properties, {[CuI4CuII(Et2dtc)2Cl3][CuII(Et2dtc)2]2(FeCl4)}n (Et2dtc- = diethyldithiocarbamate), was synthesized and crystallog. characterized. This complex has a two-dimensional infinite square lattice structure, including both Cu(I) and Cu(II) ions, which is confirmed by XPS and SQUID measurements. The ferroelec. behaviors are revealed by the dielec. measurements with a LCR meter and a ferroelec. tester.

        17c
        Coexistence of ferroelectricity and ferromagnetism in a rubidium manganese hexacyanoferrate
        Ohkoshi, Shin-ichi; Tokoro, Hiroko; Matsuda, Tomoyuki; Takahashi, Hitomi; Irie, Hiroshi; Hashimoto, Kazuhito
        Angewandte Chemie, International Edition (2007), 46 (18), 3238-3241CODEN: ACIEF5; ISSN:1433-7851. (Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA)
        Multiferroic material RbI0.82MnII0.20MnIII0.80[FeII(CN)6]0.80[FeIII(CN)6]0.14·H2O displays both ferroelectricity, explained by a mixing of FeII, FeIII, Fe vacancies, MnII, and Jahn-Teller-distorted MnIII centers, and ferromagnetism, caused by a parallel ordering of the magnetic spins of MnIII.

        A novel 3-D (3,6)-connected topol. architecture, [Cd(trtr)2]n, obtained by reacting Cd(ClO4)2·6H2O with Htrtr (Htrtr = 3-(1,2,4-triazole-4-yl)-1H-1,2,4-triazole) under solvothermal conditions, presents a non-centrosym. polar packing arrangement as indicated by X-ray crystallog., resulting in a strong second harmonic generation (SHG) response and ferroelec. property.

        17e
        Observation of Ferroelectricity in Paramagnetic Copper Octacyanomolybdate
        Nakagawa, Kosuke; Tokoro, Hiroko; Ohkoshi, Shin-ichi
        Inorganic Chemistry (2008), 47 (23), 10810-10812CODEN: INOCAJ; ISSN:0020-1669. (American Chemical Society)
        The authors report the observation of ferroelectricity in a copper octacyanomolybdate-based paramagnet, Cu2[Mo(CN)8]·8H2O (CuII, S = 1/2; MoIV, S = 0). This compd. has a f.p. for the fixation of hydrogen bonding at 150 K. Around this temp., an enhancement in the ferroelectricity and an increase in the dielec. const. are obsd. The ferroelectricity of this system is classified into amorphous ferroelecs.; i.e., the elec. poling effect induces an elec. polarization. The elec. polarization is maintained by the structural local disorder of hydrogen bonding and the three-dimensional CN network. In this ferroelectricity, the crystal structure is a polar group of C∞v after application of an elec. field.

        17f
        Assembling chirality into magnetic nanowires: cyano-bridged iron(III)-nickel(II) chains exhibiting slow magnetization relaxation and ferroelectricity
        Wang, Cai-Feng; Li, Dong-Ping; Chen, Xin; Li, Xiao-Ming; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zuo, Jing-Lin; You, Xiao-Zeng
        Chemical Communications (Cambridge, United Kingdom) (2009), (45), 6940-6942CODEN: CHCOFS; ISSN:1359-7345. (Royal Society of Chemistry)
        The assembly of chirality into magnetic nanowires enables the formation of two new cyano-bridged heterobimetallic 3,2-chain enantiomeric complexes {[(Tp)2Fe2(CN)6Ni3(L)6](ClO4)4·2H2O}n (L = (1S,2S)- and (1R,2R)-cyclohexane-1,2-diamine), representing the first example of multiferroic compds. bearing both slow magnetization relaxation and ferroelectricity. The crystal structures of both enantiomers were detd. The structure consists of {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3Ni(L)2]2}2+ and [Ni(L)2]2+ units bridged by CN groups.

        17h
        Syntheses, Structures, and Physical Properties of Camphorate Coordination Polymers Controlled by Semirigid Auxiliary Ligands with Variable Coordination Positions and Conformations
        Liang, Xiao-Qiang; Li, Dong-Ping; Li, Cheng-Hui; Zhou, Xin-Hui; Li, Yi-Zhi; Zuo, Jing-Lin; You, Xiao-Zeng
        Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (6), 2596-2605CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        New coordination polymers, {[Zn(1,2-bimb)(D-ca)]·2H2O}n (1), [Zn(1,3-bimb)(D-ca)]n (2), [Cd(1,3-bimb)(D-ca)]n (3), [Zn(1,4-bimb)(D-ca)]n (4), and {[Cd2(dpys)(D-ca)2(H2O)2]·H2O}n (5), (D-H2ca = D-camphoric acid, 1,2-bimb = 1,2-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, 1,3-bimb = 1,3-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, 1,4-bimb = 1,4-bis(imidazol-1-ylmethyl)benzene, dpys = 4,4'-dipyridylsulfide), were prepd. under hydrothermal conditions and characterized by elemental analyses, IR, vibrational CD, thermogravimetric and x-ray structural analyses. Their structures and properties can be tuned by variable coordination positions and conformations of the auxiliary ligands. Complex 1 features a three-dimensional (3D) supramol. framework with a 1-dimensional (1D)-nanosized channel. Complexes 2 and 3 show acentric 1-dimensional double-stranded chains. The chiral two-dimensional sheet with (4,4) topol. is found in compd. 4. Compd. 5 displays a 1-dimensional ladder-like chain. Photoluminescent properties of 1 and 5 were studied. Compds. 2-5 display a second-order nonlinear optical effect and ferroelec. behaviors.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXlt1WrtrY%253D&md5=b75016615cd56a131b30ac92f4dc2600
        (i) Su, Z.; Fan, J.; Okamura, T.; Sun, W. Y.; Ueyama, N. Cryst. Growth Des. 2010, 10, 3515
        [ACS Full Text ], [CAS], Google Scholar
        17i
        Ligand-directed and pH-controlled assembly of chiral 3d-3d heterometallic metal-organic frameworks
        Su, Zhi; Fan, Jian; Okamura, Taka-aki; Sun, Wei-Yin; Ueyama, Norikazu
        Crystal Growth & Design (2010), 10 (8), 3515-3521CODEN: CGDEFU; ISSN:1528-7483. (American Chemical Society)
        Use of unsym. ligand 1,2,4-benzenetricarboxylic acid (1,2,4-H3BTC) and controlling the reaction pH value enabled isolation of two novel chiral 3d-3d heterometallic complexes [Zn2Co(tib)3(H2O)5][Zn6(tib)2(1,2,4-BTC)6]·12.7H2O (1) and [ZnCo(tib)(1,2,4-BTC)(H2O)2]Cl·3H2O (2) [tib = 1,3,5-tris(1-imidazolyl)benzene]. Comparative study revealed that the use of sym. ligand 1,3,5-benzenetricarboxylic acid (1,3,5-H3BTC) resulted one achiral 3d-3d heterometallic complex [ZnCo(tib)(1,3,5-BTC)Cl] (3) with 3-dimensional structure. Complex 1 is a 2-dimensional network with cationic and anionic layers arranged alternately, while 2 is a 3-dimensional framework with rare 1-dimensional helical water chains. Also, complex 1 displays ferroelec. behavior with a remnant elec. polarization (Pr) of ∼0.177 μC/cm2 and an elec. coercive field (Ec) of ∼17.68 kV/cm.
        >> More from SciFinder ®
        https://chemport.cas.org/services/resolver?origin=ACS&resolution=options&coi=1%3ACAS%3A528%3ADC%252BC3cXns1Cmtbs%253D&md5=04960d4b43af160c7aa1d2a5c9059ff1
